review: I absolutely love their spinach artichoke dip! It is one of the most delicious things I've ever tasted. I cannot dine in at a CPK without ordering their spinach artichoke dip ($11.69). Another item I always have to order is their signature BBQ chicken pizza ($15.49). We also ordered their Garlic cream with Chicken pasta ($16.79) and it was so creamy and delicious! As soon as my boyfriend and I sat down, it got really busy so our server wasn't able to come to our table as often as we'd like. Ip did apologize and we were totally fine with it. We still got our fresh bread from Jeff (whom I believe is the manager)! He was able to help Ip out by refilling our waters and getting us cheese and pepper flakes! We had a wonderful lunch dining at CPK and I appreciate how consistent every CPK is with their ingredients. Their BBQ chicken pizza has tasted the same since I first tried it when I was in elementary school! The employees seemed understaffed but were so professional and kept their composure throughout. I applaud them for it!

No wonder this place has such a low rating on yelp. The African American woman at the take out counter didn't want to come out to deliver my order, so I went inside. Then she gave me the wrong salad. We got a roasted vegetable salad with salmon on top, she gave me a bowl of raw lettuces with several super dry salmon cubes on top, and charged me $21.69 for it.  Don't come to this CPK, the food court inside of the mall is probably a much better choice.

I've been to several CPKs and this one was by far the worst. The food was the same as it is at any location, but the ambiance and service was awful. My husband and I got to the location after my friends had been seated. There were 4 of us all together and we only got 2 menus at the table despite them being aware that we would be joining a couple minutes after they were seated. When we asked for more menus they looked panicked and must have forgotten or not had any more because they didn't bring menus or mention it when they came back to take our orders. We put in our orders and the food came eventually, but they forgot my husband's order so that took another 15 minutes and I let him eat some of my food while he waited. When his food finally came out it was great. I was downing water so I had to run to the restroom a couple times and each time I went in the bathroom was a mess and there was a group of drunk girls in front of the mirror. The first time it was funny watching them stumble around like idiots, but after the 3rd time I got run into while standing at the sink washing my hands. At that point the drunk girls were wasted and started getting aggressive with myself and the other patrons. It was clear this restaurant overserved that group several drinks too many. When I came back and we got our check, I thought we made it clear earlier that the check was being split for the two couples so we could get our own CPK card points, but apparently it wasn't so I asked for it when the bill came as one. They said they couldn't split it on the paper check but could take both cards and do it manually in the system, so we handed over our cards. When the bill came back I was given the wrong credit card so they grabbed it from me and after 10 minutes gave me my card back. I had a feeling they messed something up so I checked my bank account and it turns out they charged me $100 for someone else's meal in addition to the $30 meal we ate. I saw the reversal pending on my account, but it was a weekend so I knew it was going to take a couple of days to get that money back whether I complained or not so I just didn't leave a tip (which I never do) and got out of there as quickly as I could. The money is back now, but the memory of that experience has destroyed my view of CPK. I have a feeling the attitude and lack of service might just be this mall. It was packed and parking was a nightmare. It felt like black Friday or Christmas Eve with how pushy and rude people were acting. Whatever it was, I don't plan on going back to that CPK or mall again.

CPK is okay. Their pizzas are over priced for me and the pastas are whatever. What makes me coming back for more is their butter cake!!! Who doesn't love butter cake? Comes with ice cream and whipped cream :)  Service here was attentive and the waiter was really nice and even brought out lemons with our water. I'll away order butter cake here. Comes out warm and is a perfect combo with the cold ice cream

Food: Huge fan of the avocado egg roll. It's fried perfectly with bits of bacon, avocado, etc in it.  Come with thousand island and ranch dips. BBQ Chicken pizza and Carne Asada pizza was delicious as well.  Service was ok. Took a while for us to get our water refills. Also, our server seem so tired of his job. Caught him multiple time smiling to us as we talk but once he moves away, the smile drops faster than the speed of light. He just seemed done. Right when we got our pizza and started eating, our bill was given to us immediately. Almost felt like we were being told to get out asap (maybe they have to give you your bill asap? Not sure...). Overall, I love the food here and it's worth going to. Service is a hit or miss though.

I don't know what blew me away, the great food or the excellent customer service we received from Annie Jo! I haven't been to this location in years, I stopped going because of the bad service LOL, recently my sister reintroduced us back to CPK (the Irvine location) and we were hooked! It started with the small bites and bread and then it turned into a love fest of all their yummy food!! My sister has their app on her phone and it makes it so easy to place your order and customize from beginning to end! If your like me and prefer extra sauce and cheese this makes it easy to get what you really want and leave off what you don't want LOL! We already know the pizza is solid but their other entrees are delicious! I enjoyed the spaghetti bologense along with my fried mac and cheese bites! My sister came over last week and we figuring out what we wanted for dinner since we were in the area and I'm really glad we decided to give this location another chance! Even though we a did a to-go order the wonderful Annie Jo made us feel like VIPs! She was running the pick up order station and was on point! When we asked for extra bread and ranch she delivered! Nor did she have an attitude unlike most people when you ask for extras or charge you for them! Every step of the way she had a great attitude! At the last minute I decided to get one of their drinks to go and she didn't skip a beat, gave us a smile and it was ready in two seconds! She made sure we had all of our food and extras, she gave us so many olive oil, utensils and napkins! I only hope the rest of the staff takes a lesson on how to give green customer service like Annie Jo does! She is so friendly and inviting, making you feel valued as a customer! We were so enthralled with her great customer service we even called later that same night even though they had closed the manager answered the phone and was happy to hear about our great service! I hope Annie Jo gets the props and recognition she deserves! ^___^

Do not say the wait will be 25 min when you are clearly under staffed and it's a Friday night. We inquired with the hostess and manager after 30 min, they sat d we were the next party. We waited 45 min, and had to leave, it's a Friday night, it's been a long week, it's 8:00 Oman's we are starving. Poor management, know your wait times, your staffs capabilities and your Friday night crowd.

Friendly staff. Right when I walked in, David immediately freeted me and I asked for take out. He said it is rifht that way, Corey will take care of you. Sat down, drank some refreshing H20, got ma food, will update after food

Came here for dinner. The food was great but service was lacking. Food/Drinks: Good - Ordered the Spinach Dip, BBQ Chicken Pizza, Hawaiian Pizza, Kung Pao Noodles, and Chicken Tequila Fettuccine. - I have to say the pastas stole the show on this one. My favorite pasta was the Kung Pao. It was sweet and slightly spicy after you have a lot. I really enjoyed it. - I had a small taste of the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine and remember it tasting good but can't recall the flavoring on this one - The two pizzas were mediocre and didn't really stand out. The Hawaiian Pizza was primarily dough and you couldn't taste the flavors of the pineapple and ham.  - The BBQ Chicken Pizza let you taste the sauce and was good but I preferred the noodles - Also ordered the Strawberry and Lime Cooler, de-li-cious. It was sweet and tangy, but after one it got slightly too sweet for me. Seating/Parking/Service: Decent - Tons of parking since it's located at Brea Mall - We didn't have a hard time finding a table for a party of 7 - Our waitress was kind and patient with helping us find something to eat - I could tell the servers, who brought the food out were ready to leave for the day since they would just drop off the food without bringing utensils, plates, or napkins.  Overall, I liked the food here and would recommend getting the pastas over the pizza but this wouldn't be a go to place for me unless I'm already at the mall and hungry.

My husband hadn't eaten at a CPK in years, and our visit to this location in Brea in June was the first time we'd ever eaten at CPK together. We weren't expecting much -- maybe mediocre food and service -- but it exceeded our expectations. We were seated right away, and the manager Jeff introduced several of the new menu items to us. He really wanted us to try something new, so he had a server bring us the spicy buffalo cauliflower appetizer -- free of charge! It was surprisingly really tasty. My husband said he would definitely eat that again. We ordered pizzas for our meal, and they were delicious as always. I love their pizza dough. Our server checked on us several times to see how we were doing, and we got some drink refills as well. It was a nice experience eating here. So nice that I'd likely eat here again in the near future.

Introduction: I would say that I come to this CPK location at least once a week. Always get consistent great food and service. Being served by Scott for the second time is what prompted me to type them this updated review. Quality: 5/5 The quality of the food is always consistently amazing! We got the Wedge Salad with Ranch dressing vs blue cheese and BBQ Chicken Pizza with bacon and garlic, well done with extra cilantros and red onions.  Both came out perfectly and equally outstanding.  5 stars all the way! Quantity: 5/5 The portions were super generous, we barely finished them, so definitely enough for two. Especially when it comes with free courtesy breads.  We prefer eating the bread with butter vs the free oil dipping sauce.  Customer Service: 5/5 As previously mentioned above, we were serviced by Scott twice and today was no exception. Scott was on point, I was blown away by how many tables he covered and was still amazing.  I hope I get him every time, talking about amazing service!  Cleanliness: 5/5 Of course 5 stars, this place is nothing other than immaculate. So clean you can eat off the table if you drop something.  Price: 5/5 If you get great service and and great food, which we did, nothing is too expensive at that point. Miscellaneous: I can't say about other CPK's, but if you haven't tried the one in Brea, I highly recommend it.  Especially served by the one and only Scott.

This CPK has 5 Star customer service. We came here for dinner, and to say they took care of us is an understatement. The host, server, and bartender (Michael) were all friendly and management (David) hooked it up. They let me order a lunch special for dinner!! Thank you!

When the kids love CPK and it's their birthday, you take them to CPK. Yes, it's a chain restaurant so you generally don't expect too much. What I did not expect was to spend 2 hour at the restaurant for this meal. No, it's not because we were having so much fun. It was because our server Israel was the worst. We sat at the tail end of the lunch rush on a Sunday. At that point, the restaurant was only 3/4 full. 40 minutes to order and get drinks. Good luck with refills. I would have had better luck walking to the food court and buying drinks for the table. 40 minutes to get our food, then the waiter wants to argue about what we ordered. We ALWAYS get exactly the same thing (come on, you know how it is with kids) so don't argue that we ordered something different. Even if we did, where is your customer service?? Then Israel disappeared never to be heard from again. Just kidding. He did not come back to check on the table or offer drink refills (The kids were thirsty). Another 40ish minutes to get the check. Really? Do you know how difficult it is to keep a 7yo and two 5 yos content for that length of time in a restaurant?? We were so frustrated, we didn't even order a dessert for the birthday kids. We just wanted out of there. Waiting, waiting, waiting, We put the credit card away and paid cash. We couldn't wait any longer. We had to walk up to the bar to get take-out containers for our food.  As we were getting up from the table to leave, suddenly Israel appeared. I'm sure he wanted to make sure we paid. I let him know we were disappointed with the service. It was the worst service we have had at this type of restaurant. He just started blankly. No apology. Nothing. Not seeing a manager around, I went and complained to the hostesses. They apologized and said they would inform the manager. I heard Israel tell a different table he was "slammed." Umm, sure. The restaurant was not even half full at that point. Since I did not get to speak to a manager, I contacted corporate. I received an email stating someone would get back to me within the next few days. Good thing I didn't hold my breath. It's been 4 weeks now. I waited to write this review, giving them the benefit of the doubt that it would be resolved. Obviously CPK does not care about customer service. Thanks, but no thanks.  If you come to this location, make sure you are not seated in Israel's section. God forbid you have an issue. Management won't help you out either.

Came in today for the first time to celebrate my mother in law's birthday. To be honest I was expecting a little bit more. The prices are reasonable and portions are ok but this would not be a place where I would regularly go for a bite.

We had a nice lunch here yesterday.  Ordered a kids pepperoni pizza, one BBQ chicken salad, and one carne asada pizza. We also got the cucumber reviver drink. Everything was fresh and tasted good and our service was fast and friendly despite being busy. Look forward to going back again soon.

Came here with my grand daughter for a dinner. The server was thoughtful and tried her best to accommodate us on her best ability. I love their jambalaya pasta and their egg rolls. Nice place to finish off the night after a long day of shopping. Wish they would just open little longer so we wouldn't have to rush eating. Overall great place.

This location is located in the Brea Mall.  ASPARAGUS & ARUGULA SALAD: one of the healthy options. This salad was light and tasty.  WILD MUSHROOM PIZZA-The pizza was alright, I wish it came warmer and thiner. GARLIC CREAM PASTA WITH MUSHROOM,-The garlic cream pasta was really yummy. It was creamy and flavorful. CHICKEN TEQUILA FETTUCINE, -The best dish of tonight. It tasted kind of like Thai Food, a little sour and spicy. Perfect for a hot summer night.  STRAWBERRY LIME MARGARITA-I did not like this drink, too sweet for me. Overall， CPK was more than just a pizza place, their other dishes were amazing too.

What better way to celebrate mid-week then with drinks?!  We were seated immediately around 6pm towards the back. Service was excellent by our funny male waiter (I can't remember his name). We ordered 2 drinks, a large bbq chicken salad, and a california club pizza (YES). Total with tax was about $48. Too bad there is no happy hour at CPK =( During our stay, I noticed everyone looking out a window (including the staff) so I walked over to check out what was happening. Police were making arrests right outside! Woah. CPK is located at the Brea mall.

We normally love CPK so we stopped at the Brea location (Sun 10/22 around 2:30) expecting the usual great food and service. Checked in at hostess desk and got a pager, hostess was really friendly and said 10 mins. We waited for awhile then noticed seats at the bar wide open. We were so hungry we sat down and gave the pager back to hostess. Took about 5 mins for bartender to acknowledge us and she said to give her a minute. She then took about 5 minutes to make 1 drink then took that persons order and walked away. We sat there about 15 minutes with not even a glass of water, bar flies buzzing around in our faces. We were wishing we had just waited for a table instead. We ended up leaving without ordering and won't be back.

I've stopped in here many a time and also love their salads!  My favorite is the grilled vege with chicken!!  Brandon has been our server multiple times and does an outstanding job!! He's on top of it!! If you save your receipt, you'll get 20% off your next check not to mention you can earn reward bucks toward your meals!!  Sign-up and save a buck!!

We usually love CPK, so this is difficult to write this 1-star review, but write it I must. The main problem we had at this Brea location was the poor service (never actually received our meal, so I can't comment much on the food). We should've learned our lesson from a previous visit, in which the manager profusely apologized for poor service and gave us coupons for free entrees on a future visit. Since there were many months in between these two visits, we still had hopes for a decent experience, but we will not EVER be back to this location.  We were there for lunch on a Wednesday, arriving around 12:40 pm. We were seated promptly in the remodeled SUPER-NOISY barn of a dining room. That right there cast a pall on the visit, as my husband and I had to shout to be heard over the din. I realize hard surfaces are easy to clean, but they don't make for a good conversational atmosphere. Obviously a big reason for the remodel was so they could cram more seating in there. Looks like the service hasn't caught up with the bigger capacity.  It took at least 15 minutes for anyone to stop by our table and acknowledge us, not even a glass of water. That should've tipped us off. Finally a waitress apologized and took our drink and food order. Husband's drink came out, but not my San Pellegrino. We both ordered soup and salads. 5-10  minutes later my soup arrives, but not hubby's soup or my drink yet (WTH?). I'm feeling rude as I apologetically begin eating, as the soup is already not as hot as it should be. My drink arrived about 5 minutes after my soup. We waited another 10-15 minutes or so, with no additional food in sight, no one checking in, and finally got disgusted and left (we left $20 on the table, which was $20 more than the experience was worth). UNACCEPTABLE LEVEL OF SERVICE!!! 40 minutes without food is just too long. SOME SERIOUS SERVICE and MANAGEMENT ISSUES at Brea CPK. Guess I'll learn to make that salad at home. We walked over to the Nordstrom Cafe and had a delightful meal.

My family and I love coming here from time to time. Their service is great and the wait time is not too bad considering its busy location. If you still have room for dessert, try the Belgian Chocolate Soufflé Cake!
Horrible service.  Waited, with family and friends, for 30 minutes without neither a word nor any consideration.   Never going back.

I just want to say thank you to Michael for the excellent service today. He was very attentive to all of his tables especially to refills. I could tell he was slammed only because I am a server and knew he was the only one on up front and he did a great job! Thank you Michael!!

This CPK is my only experience with this particular chain, I moved from out of state & didn't have one close by. Of course, the pizza is good but they've got lots of delicious-sounding options on the menu. The Quinoa + Arugula Salad with house-made champagne vinaigrette made me drool a little. Maybe the Hearth-Roasted Halibut on a cedar plank with butternut squash farro? I couldn't order something that required googling the side dish, haha. It sounds delicious though.  We ended up with the roasted garlic chicken (whole wheat crust) and roasted artichoke and spinach pizzas (thin crust w/chicken added for $2). My thin crust pizza was great, crispy and cheesy. The crust on the garlic chicken pizza was a little but sweet, and chewy. I thought that the wilted scallions and gorgonzola went well with the chicken and garlic, it was yummy. We had an awesome lunch here on Sunday afternoon. The wait was only about 15 mins & the food came out super quick even while the place was packed! Great visit :-)
Wow Jeff & Kayce are amazing! She is an incredible server & Jeff is also so nice! Had the most delicious meal & cant wait to come back. Thanks for everything!

**Disappointing Buttercake** I was looking forward to their new desserts. Buttercake being one of them. It was more of a crumbly texture, like corn bread. I hate corn bread! It was not like cake at all.  ;(  The pizza was pretty good. I got the California veggie. The Sesame Chicken Salad is my favorite, but since I don't care for meat, I take out most of the chicken. I should ask if they could give me more salad if I ask to leave out the chicken.  They used to serve a brownie sundae a while back but I am not sure they have that anymore. Now I am not sure if every location is the same but I was at The Spectrum location and the server encouraged me to order a NEW dish that I haven't tried, saying that if I don't like it, they'll take back and bring back a dish that I normally buy. Just throwing it out there.  Thanks for reading! ~*Kenzie*~ P.S. You can also order online and pick up at the restaurant. They normally reserve a couple of parking spots for pick-up. And PLEASE please tip, even though you are just picking up. The person who does phone orders, only does that. They package everything up and make sure you got everything. They don't get paid much. At least give them a buck. BE NICE.  :)

so upset... havent been here in a long time. their food usually good. To-go  was usually soso..... today.. i was starving and it was 8pm... long day so i ordered to go... a flatbread appetizer n the arugula n quinoa salad...i added chicken for $4.50. so an hour later i open the salad to eat... and what do i discover!???.....NO CHICKEN!!!!! SO DISAPPOINTED!!!!.... boy do i really need to refrain from using thos service at this location..

Poor service. Our server was quite forgetful. I had to repeat my simple requests for water, bread, butter and vinegar. He also got my grandmother's order wrong. She ordered a pizza with chicken and the pizza came out with just spinach and artichokes. When we told our server about the mistake, he said he would have them make her a new pizza. Instead, he came back with a side dish of chopped up cold chicken breast. "So she'll have some protein in there," is what he said. Yeah, because that made the pizza all better right? Never coming back to this location again.

Absolutely loved the service! Jeff was awesome at helping me know where to go for take-out, and my take out server Sabrina was great! She knew the menu very well, and included all of the condiments and side of bread (which I had never been offered before back there) and has a friendly smile! I tipped her well and thanked the manager for being so helpful. I will definitely be back again, hopefully to see Sabrina and Jeff again!!

Very poor service. Not the waitress's fault, the place is seriously understaffed for a Friday night. After getting seated it took 10 minutes for the waitress to visit us and take both Fiji's and drink orders.  The bread and drinks arrived +5 minutes later. When we asked the staff for refills on our soda... the pizza we ordered beat the second round of Cokes.
Not sure how they serve but it is really slow. We waited for half an hour for our pizza, watching people came in after us enjoying theirs. They definitely need more hands.

I went to cpk the other day. I go there often I would have to say and I just wanted to say I had an exceptional hostess Alyssa or lyss that was not only gorgeous but was so happy and warm. There was a long wait becuase people love this place and I thought my wait was going to be long. But she kept checking in on my pager making sure that I was okay and knew how long. She seated me promptly and helped bring me bread and water cuz I was starving. She not only did this when we sat down but when I was waiting my son was very thirsty and she offered to bring him water while we wait. She really is a face to this restaurant and I'm happy they trained and hired such a wonder girl. Thank you LYSS
5 star for the customer service!!! The crew and the chef are easy to communicate with. Will always go back there for this reason.
Horrible and slow service! We got there and there were   people behind us, but they ordered while we waited 20 minutes for our server to come!

First time at this restaurant. Two stars because food was good. Service was also good until I asked 3 times for our check to be separate amongst us 4. I work in disability services so my clients need their own receipts and our waiter gave us the HARDEST time! Before we ordered, I asked if that was possible and he said yes no problem! But when I asked him to do it after he brought one check, he had a nasty attitude. Very displeased and disappointed. I really wanted to love this place.

Amazing lunch special! Amazing customer service! Our server was Todd. Omg! He was amazing! Very professional! Great attitude! The manager on duty is amazing and friendly! The way we were treated will make us come back again and again! -Karl

It was ok I mean it was ok tasting but the price was 15$ for this small little thing. I can go to Costco and get 2x more food for 10$. and taste wise Costco isn't that far off from cpk imo. Sorry but not worth the price.

CPK got a facelift and it looks nice.  Barn-chic style. Pretty cool. Their menu is easier to follow and it takes you directly to other plates rather than just their pizzas.  I had the chicken piccata today and I loved it.  It was delicious.  I really recommend it.  The lemonade was too sweet so that's minus one star. Lol. But the server and the greeters were super!!   So come and enjoy!!!

Not a huge fan of this location. Came here one afternoon to refuel after a 3-hour shopathon at Brea Mall. The floors were dirty and that was the 1st thing I noticed. We ordered an appetizer, a pizza, a salad and a pasta dish to share. We got our appetizer pretty quickly, but when our server brought our plates they were unwashed and had food stuck to them. ewwww. The 2nd set of plates we got had residue water mark from the dish detergent, and I had to use my napkin to clean them myself. It's disturbing.  Our meat craver pizza was pretty tasty but the pasta we got had some undercooked shrimps in there, not a fan of raw seafood unless it's at a reputable sushi place. Then we ordered the brownie dessert and the brownie was dry, powdery and hard: tasted like it was frozen and reheated in the microwave. Yuck!  Would not recommend.

1. Taste: typical pizza taste nothing very special. We ordered a pizza spaghetti and a salad nothing caught my attantion. 1 2. Service: pretty good I was about to oreder a BBQ chicken salad and a BBQ chicken pizza, the waiter advised me not to because both trays will be taste the same I very appreciated this. 5 3. Hygiene. Very good 4 4. Environment it could get very loud at times. 3 I choose to give 2 because I would rank the taste as first priority

This place is ok. It's just some people work here make the restaurant look bad. At other location such as Huntington Beach or Victoria Garden mall don't charge you ridiculous price for a substitute salad with the rib eye dish. I could not eat angular salad and asked for green or house salad instead, some guy came out and said will be extra $3 which is so awful. Other location just give it for free. It is not like the salad come with is big, it is just really small and vegetable is very cheap. I have to pay almost $27 for rib eye steak and they charge me more for that. Terrible business.

I do not get this place.  I do not get it at all. I've eaten at CPK's maybe 2-3 times prior, and never liked it. We came to Brea mall on Saturday to get some late mother's day shopping in. We were hungry and couldn't decide what to eat on, but we happened to park at the entrance where CPK is located on.  Against my past experiences, I gave it another chance. So I'll start with the food.  I got a pepperoni pizza.  It was pretty decent, but to be fair it's kinda hard to screw up a pepperoni pizza.  Girlfriend got a green pasta thing, forgot what it was called.  It was pretty good, but be warned I've been told it makes your poop green.  So you just kinda gotta weigh that out if it's worth it. Now, this dining experience adding into my previous CPK experiences pretty much solidifies that I will never eat at CPK again. We got seated like right in front of a huge elementary school party.  At one point, all we could hear is 25 kids yelling "CHEEESE CHEEESE" for 5 minutes straight to take a picture.  There were like 15 kids in front of our table playing with balloons like volleyballs.  At one point, a few of them decided they wanted to play with us (we didn't want to play) and we got balloons thrown at us repeatedly. Not only was this a huge annoyance, but this is also dangerous - common sense where there is hot food being moved around is not a good place for kids to be running around.   Disappointed the parents didn't keep the children under controlled but even more disappointed because CPK should have said something.  I saw one kid fall.  I saw one girl almost hit her head on the corner of a table. No place that allows this kind of behavior should have steaks on their menu.  CPK is like Chucky Cheese's pseudo-classy, lame cousin.
Today was asparagus and arugula salad  accompanied with their OG bbq chicken pizza.  Love it. My kids can't get enough of their Mac n cheese. Can never go wrong with CPK!

Great service. This review is specifically for a server named Ashley who was honestly one of the best waitresses I've ever met! She was direct and really know how to anticipate her customers's needs without being overly cherry or overly enthusiastic or chatty--she was merely doing her job. Food wise, CPK is always one of those places where you can't really go wrong-as a chain restaurant, it is definitely one of the better ones. If you want to avoid the wait make sure to just ask to sit at the bar.
The service was excellent!! Monique was the greatest. Actually the whole staff displayed great teamwork!!

We went here for lunch. The food was good. The service was ok. The biggest problem is the food took 40 mins. It was not that busy in the resturant so I don't really understand the hold up. Our waited came and touched based with us letting us know the food is coming but 40 mins is a long time even when we are being updated.

On Sept 18th we went the Brea Mall CPK with our Girl Scout troop #3596 went to have a tour and eat at your restaurant and we very disappointed. The girls didn't get learn anything about owning a business, or how long you been established, how many pizza you make in a day. They gave us dough and left us alone at the table for over 20mins. We have been on other tours from other restaurants and they were AMAZING! This was an awful experience for the girls. We never saw the manager or owner. We had to pay $10 per girl. The Girl Scouts is a nonprofit organization.... I was disgusted by the lack of cleanliness of the kitchen. There was raw chicken and Shrimp left out defrosting in a tub on the floor. We had to walk on the wet slippery floor with dirty dishes everywhere. I mean Really!!! They didn't even seem like they to care that 15 little girls and there moms were coming to visit their restaurant that day. It looked like nobody even cleaned up from the night before, that's a health violation for sure. I will not go back to that restaurant or any other CPK ever again because of the uncleanliness of your establishment. I felt like we should have got a better tour or even apology from the manager. I've called the manager a few times and he doesn't even seem to care. I'm sorry I wish I had better things to say about my experience at CPK. I've called corporate a few times and left messages, I've Instagram, twitter, and facebook and I've got no reply back from anyone. I would like to try to resolve this issue somehow for the Girl Scouts.
Great customer service!!  Brandon was a awesome server!! The food is good but a bit pricey. The adult drinks are pretty good.

Located inside the brea mall, the location is a decent size but can get pretty crowded. We came during lunch time on a Saturday and were lucky enough to get seated right away.  Their food is delicious! The bread was probably the worst part of the meal since it was a little tough to chew, but the rest was perfect. From my yummy strawberry lemonade to their incredibly delicious Kung Pao Spaghetti (a must try!). Everything tasted great. The waiter was really nice and gave the best advice to add mushrooms to my spaghetti, I can never go back to eating it without mushrooms, it was sooo good!  Love CPK restaurants!

I've been coming to CPK for over a decade, I've been to different ones from all over Southern California, I live near Brea so we frequent this one more so along with Cerritos. So let me say I've never had a poor meal at any single one. And I've given nothing but 4 or 5 stars at CPK. Love bringing my family here. But today at this location in Brea the dark haired girl that  Greeted us at the front that writes down your name for seating was a completely Rude none welcoming negative from her tone to the look on her eyes and expression on her face. Sorry you are in the business of service with a smile, when you speak to a customer you look them in the eye and smile and say or greet politely not some mumble or glance up then look down and mumble some trash out of your I'm so exhausted attitude because your sitting down not doing shit & getting paid for it. And you can't muster common courtesies to patrons.

This is a very good location for CPK. This is my first time being here. Sat at the bar since I thought it would be faster. Amanda was working at the bar.  I wanted to get food fast and go my way. Apparently taking a bigger order over the phone is their priority rather than the guest sitting at the bar.  I was really disappointed by waiting 25 minutes for my appetizer to come in and obviously waiting that long there is no more appetite for entrée. They are busy over the phone I understand, but common pay attention to the customers that are at the restaurant as well. For a company this big, they need to hire more employees, rather than having one person take care of catering as well as the bar. VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!!!!!

Our server Bri was absolutely amazing! She was very personable and sweet! She informed me about all the new beverages and desserts that CPK offered! That was the first experience that I had where it was fun and friendly in the 10+ years that I have gone. Jesse, the manager was also very helpful and informative. Very fun and friendly this past Friday night! It was a great experience and I appreciated the service I received from Bri and Jesse! Best I have ever come across at any CPK!

This is based on my most recent visit to this CPK location. I ordered my food at 12 to be ready for pickup at 1. When I came in it was a little later then my pickup time. I was standing at the bar and at least 5 employees looked at/passed by me and said nothing. I had to go up to the front and ask someone to help me. This visit really left me with a bad experience.

Came here for lunch.. Pretty busy for a Saturday, but they seated us pretty quickly.  Appleberry Sangria, Avocado Egg Rolls, Half Thai Crunch Salad, Half Habanero Carnitas Pizza and Half California Club Pizza.

I wish I didn't have to give it a 1 star because I have been coming to this location for years now but this last year there have been multiple reasons why this restaurant is below par!  The service is inconsistent- a hit or miss and today it was a miss!  The waiter was wiping checkbooks while our food sat on the counter waiting for him to pick up. We asked for bread 5 times and never received it. He even told us it was still baking when we noticed the two tables next to us all received hot bread.  When we asked him to check on the food we waited almost an hour for he said it was still cooking.  When the food finally came it was cold and the kids' pastas were hard and dry. We always order the chicken piccata and every other time lately it's not made to taste correctly. Today it was so cold AND THE ANGEL HAIR WAS AGAIN BOILED IN A CLUMP!   IT was so unsatisfying; It's definitely not worth $16.99.    We waited so long we ate what we got and hurried home to get the kids to bed but we are sick of having to complain to management. They need to get it right!

The lack of service tonight from our server Ashley was not that of a professional. Luckily, we had a great manager that not only sat us, but took our order as well. Only saw her twice and did not introduce herself either time. If you are sat in her area request to be moved.

California style pasta n pizza, I like them better than Italian style. ;p  This is our usual dinner spot after shopping at Brea mall. I don't eat pizza n pasta too often, but I like CPK a lot.  They have many kinds of salads, light but very flavored. They always add new items, love the small dishes they have now, as well as thin crust pizza. It is inexpensive but the portions are not big, for a eater like me I need to order quite a few dishes. They have full bar. The bill is between $50-80 including alcohol beverages, service is always good. Good place for a casual lunch or after shopping dinner.

food is good I do love their pizza.great salads too! the only thing I dont like are the crying kids and babies since it is in the mall people bring their kids and sometimes it is NOT fun...due to their running around misbehaving or screaming...for this reason I take food to go.which seems faster cause there is always a line or wait to get in here.   I have never eaten outside which looks pretty nice.I might come try that sometime to see if its less noisy.Also place is sometimes dirty..food and dirty napkins on the floor.I like their food but prefer mine to go.if you check it out be prepared for a line or wait and screaming kids..ugh! OH but will say service is always great good waiters and waitresses very attentive.

I've always gone to this CPK and after not having gone for a while, I went back last night and they remodeled the restaurant! I absolutely love the new vibe they have now. It's like a modern/contemporary look with a natural vibe with wooden tables and desks.  They also changed/upgraded their menu, so they've taken out a few of my past favorite things, but they've also added some new things that I tried and loved. The host that served my family and I was also super nice and accommodating. Even though I've been here a lot before, my experience here yesterday made my opinion of this CPK better. Definitely go!

I went in for dinner service on a Monday night for dinner. The TV's in the dining room had Monday Night Football playing, so that was a plus. We were greeted and seated fairly quickly, and the hostess accommodated my request to be close to the TV so I could watch some football. We got some iced tea and Sam Adams IPA to start. They brought out some hot bread with some olive oil with spices to dip the bread in to start. We then ordered the Jumbalaya Pasta and the The Original BBQ Chicken Pizza with the smoked bacon. If nothing at all, CPK's food quality is the same every time on their pizzas. This is why we dine at CPK. The Jumbalaya Pasta was good. Had a hearty helping of seafood (crawfish and shrimp) and spices. We had Mary K. serve us, and she was great! We'll be back.

Service at the beginning was a little slow. We were seated and waited about 10-15 minutes unnoticed (despite multiple attempts to flag people down) but once our waitress noticed us (she had told us that no one had told her about out table) she took our order and everything from that moment on went smoothly. She refilled our drinks without asking and brought us bread while we waited for our egg rolls. Avocado egg rolls were bomb as always and one order is just enough to fill myself up or to share with someone as an appetizer.

As a Veteran, any restaurant that is willing to pay back a simple free meal on Veterans Day is alright in my book. I've been told that their pizzas are frozen and heck that might be the case, then get the pasta or a salad. I've enjoyed their kung pao spaghetti and their jambalaya and I'll say you will not be disappointed. As for your proclaimed frozen pizzas, I give them credit for their originality and creativity.  Staff and customer service has been wonderful. I can't say enough good things about this location.

Service is always good here or whenever I go ahah. The pizzas are so yummy! Which one? All of them. I usually get the chipotle pizza. Mhmm so good. I got an apple berry sangria and it is the perfect bitter and sweet taste I like. My friend got the other summer sangria and it was super sweet for my taste. The seats are pretty darn close to each other. The couple next to me kept staring at me, so I felt a little bit uncomfortable. Leave your shopping bags in your car because theres not that much room at the tables..

I come here all the time. I don't really know why it's taken me so long to post a review. If you're Italian you probably won't recognize anything on their menu as being "pizza" but I've always enjoyed everything I've ever ordered here.

This is the second time my girlfriend and I have eaten here. Both visits were excellent. The service is great, friendly, attentive, and quick. The pizza is always delicious. Both times we ordered the avocado rolls for our appetizer; which I highly suggest you try. They are delicious! Pricing for food is reasonable. They have seating inside and outside. Plenty of room for a large group. I look forward to eating here again.

This is just a note 2 commend your employee. Amanda is & has Alwayz been exceptional at caring 4 our needs. She even remembers the small things, our Wine Choice, Xtra Butter with our bread:)) She is professional, courteous & helpful!! Always a pleasure 2 have her 2 care 4 us!! A great young woman & an addition 2 your staff:)) Very Kindly Yours, Leona Strong

My least favorite CPK location because of their service. My server today wasn't very friendly besides the initial greeting. She didn't stop by to ask if things were okay or to refill the water. She also threw down the dessert menu and walked away. It made us feel like we weren't welcome even though we were only there for a short time.  Got the Hawaiian pizza- it was okay but too salty for me. My mom liked it though because she liked the pineapple and thin crust!

I really like this place. When we're hungry and want to eat right away we come here. Wait is generally short for 2. I always get the asparagus and spinach spaghettini with salmon. I am a pescetarian so this is the perfect meal.  My only problem is that they took off the gluten free crust. I have a few friends that have a gluten-intolerance so needless to say on our last visit she had to just get a salad. Besides that, it's a great place!
Amazing service ! Todd was our server and he was super friendly and had a great sense of humor. And the pizza was delicious. Will definitely be coming back to this location

This CPK SUCKED...Just came from a nice massage and wanted lunch. Waited 15 mins. for a table, and once tables were ready got seated AFTER 2 parties arrived before us. Once seated our waiter never came to see what we wanted again AFTER helping 2 tables right next to ours. The party next to us was shocked as well, and on the opposite side of us their was another couple seated and their waiter was on point with drinks and bread. Informed one of the hostesses what had happened, and they had nothing to say...I've visited a few CKP's thru out LA but have NEVER had BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE like this establishment, I truly hope management reads this because was truly terrible.
Always good service! Didn't have what we wanted so Michael hooked us up! Food is always great!

This was my favorite restaurant for how many years and I never had any problems with it until now. It seems they made some changes with the look and a lot of the servers are new. One problem I have is that they don't clean very well. The booths are always super dirty. I feel like they're really in a hurry. As well as the silverware that still has food stuck to them. It makes me sad because I love it here. They need to clean up more because it's gross.
Every time we come here they are UNDER STAFFED!!! There were 20 tables open and we have been waiting for 30 Mins!! Food is Ok! This is outrageous!!!!

I have always liked this particular location. Every time I visit the employees are always nice and accommodating. The manager was very helpful this time around and made sure our coupon went through, talked about the new CPK app, and got us the new reward card rather than my printable paper version. Our server was always there when we needed her, she even packed our left over food for us which was a plus! As always, the Tortilla Spring Rolls (Baja) were delicious! I also tried the Small Plate Arugula Salad and it was very fresh with greens, sun dried tomatoes, and asparagus which tasted great together! I will be back!
Best place to be with family. Even though prices are somewhat crazy, you can taste quality right through their food.
Probably the nicest wait staff I've encountered. The GM Anthony even brought us out a free app. Because he heard it was our first time in. Nice beer selection and really good food. Good job guys!

My favorite parking spot when we come to Brea mall is always the CPK side. Always walking by here but never cared to dine in. I been going to CPK for years at other locations, but as much as I've come to shop this mall we finally paid a visit here about a week ago. It was a Sunday morning after church and a visit from the Apple store we went in for brunch, the place was wasn't busy at all and we got seated at one of the booths very quickly and I was like f*** yea!!! my stomach was growling like crazy since mass ( excuse my Language I just left church )  So we got our menus and my mindset was to get a pizza, and for the track record CPK is known for good small hand tossed pizzas. My stomach was telling me to get the Buffalo chicken pizza BTW something caught my attention I noticed there were calorie counts labeled on every food in the menu and that buffalo chicken pizza was worth about 1400 calories!!! Whaaaaaaaaaat!?!?! Tha F************k !!!!!! for a small pizza?  I'm watching my calories so no more bloats... I don't know when the last time I had CPK but seeing calories counts for something I want to eat makes me go hands off easily, but this is new to me seeing that here and this place threw me off by surprise but hey I can't complain it's all about "Stay healthy America" I ordered the California Club pizza topped with grilled chicken, avocados,  tomatoes, lettuce, mozzarella cheese and applewood smoked bacon. It's a few hundred calories less than the Buffalo chicken pizza but it will do.  The pizza was pretty good it's light and hearty, you can add some ranch sauce on your thin crust pie, overall not bad.  To me the Cali pizza was like chicken salad on toast bread. I'm not too much a fan of chain restaurants, especially CPK's pizzas are expensive because it's coming from Wolfgang Puck's cookbook. California's Pizza's Kitchen is not hard to find, maybe I"ll hit another one up next year.

I haven't been here in years but came back and was very satisfied!! The food was awesome and the service was even better! We were greeted by a very welcoming host, Adam, and had a phenomenal server, Makenzie. She was super friendly and funny, and had great customer service skills. Definitely coming more often!!

Been coming here  since they opened. Generally a good stable restaurant in the three star range for food and service  1 star today because food took 50 minutes to come out :(.  Waiter was good seemed like the kitchen was backed up

There are only a couple of places around here to get gluten free pizza, let alone a good gluten free pizza, but this is definitely the best! I have had nothing but great experiences here. The pizza is not too thin(as with most GF pizzas) and has just the right amount of cheese, sauce, and toppings. They also use the GIG standards, which is rare to find and very impressive. The service here is excellent and the wait time is usually not too long. The only complaint in mind is that even after learning of my gluten allergy, they still brought bread. I still return here regularly with friends and family so that they can have the great experience of dining here!

Went to have dinner on a Wednesday at 7:00 and they had a lot of empty tables in and out on the patio and the wait was 25 minutes. We were told they only have five servers during the week. Bad business decision. Please improve this process.

Awesome service! The manager heard it was our first time here and gave us her favorite flatbread to try on the house! I didn't get her name but she was awesome! Will definitely be back to this location :)

I've been to the one at the Garden Walk and HATED it. It tasted more like a Home Town Buffet meal rather than an actual restaurant meal. Anyways, this place completely changed my opinion on it. I had the Jambalian pasta and shared it with my boyfriend (btw it's not that big so I don't recommend sharing) and we also had the spinach dip appetizer with pita bread. The service was fast, we got seated immediately, and service was friendly. My only complaint is the price and the dessert; just for what it was, definitely wasn't worth the price, but whatever. Also, the dessert menu was non existent... They had 4 things to choose from and for me, they were all things you'd leave on a platter at parties because nobody wants them. It was pudding and 3 other things, and also, I don't want to pay $10 for pudding that I can make at home for $1.25. At least add ice cream to the menu, I didn't get anything for dessert it all looked really in unappealing. Other than that this place can get pretty packed on busy mall days like the weekend and it's not that big inside, so you might have to wait.
I have to say CPK is kind of a guilty pleasure restaurant for me. I fully embrace it though. Special shoutout to our server Sarah who was amazing. The food was amazing as always.
Highly recommend the Harvest Kale Salad and BBQ chicken pizza! You won't regret it. Service was alright. I like the dim lighting. Coffee was okay.

Great food; the chipotle chicken fettuccine was delicious! Service, eh.  As big as how CPK is, I am quite disappointed of their service.  Nothing too horrible, its just they seemed a bit arrogant and not so friendly at all.

After finishing lunch, we haven't got the Check yet, me and my friend went to the restroom. One of the employee was eating lunch at another table and saw us going to restroom. Another employee suspected us that we were leaving without paying and he looked for us in the restroom. He came in and left when he see me washing hands. There is no exit to go outside through restroom. He should not have followed us to restroom. He should respect customers and respect privacy. I left about 13% tip even though I didn't want to.  Left of the room has many customers, we asked the table at the right side  of the room, a waitress told us there is no waiter for that side. Do they think about customers or they just think about their tips?
Good night out with my hubby.  Enjoyed a good meal of salad and pizza.  The Works is delicious with some spice. Great service- Thanks Laurissa!!!

I have dined to numerous CPK branches in different cities and the service in this particular location is very slow. Last night, my husband and I ate dinner here and ordered the Spicy Buffalo Cauliflower. When it arrived, it's obviously different from what we used to order in other CPK locations, in terms of the serving size, it's as if they chopped a 2 big cauliflower and just spread it out. Asked our server and she was clueless about the real serving size. A manager came over and talked to us, I even showed him the picture that I took and posted on my Facebook account, on how different it was in terms of the serving size. I even compared it to the picture that they have displayed on their table (they're promoting it because it's new). He said that he'll talk to their chef, BUT didn't do anything about our order. We were truly disappointed, left without any explanation why is their Spicy Buffalo Cauliflower different from the rest of other CPK branches. This isn't much of a big deal, but working in a hospitality industry as well, a restaurant should be consistent with their menu/food/recipe/size, mostly specially if they're a chain of restaurants.

Service improved a lot, since the last time I been to this location about a year ago. Food is out quickly and the server brought out my refill without me even asking. They also serve bread with olive oil now like other authentic Italian restaurants, it used to be just regular bread and butter. Food is pretty good, if you don't order anything other than pizza. I love their Hawaiian BBQ chicken pizza. The spaghetti bolognese is pretty bad here compare to BJs, Bucca, Olive Garden, Cheesecake Factory and etc,. I would just stick to their pizza next time. The price they charge is also very reasonable, it's not a bad place to visit from time to time. The parking is pretty bad if you come during weekend mall opening hours. I usually come when the mall is close to closing to avoid all the traffic.

Out of 10 CPK in Brea!!!! would get it right maybe 2 times. We live in Brea, so if we feel like CPK we have to drive down to Newport fashion island or Irvine. What a shame, we do like CPK but not the one in Brea

Excellent service and great food. Never disappointed  coming out of here ; always top notch. We ordered their chicken dumplings, roasted salad and Margarita pizza. The waitress's name is Lauren. She was fast to respond and very sweet. Loved it!

The food is average, but the service was awful.  Server didn't put in our order for 15-20 minutes, our food didn't come for another 30 minutes.  When we asked about our food, the server gave attitude like "ugh, just wait your turn, it's coming".  We also asked for separate checks at the start of our ordering, and even that came out wrong.  Talked to the manager and he seemed insincere in his apologies.  We did get a small discount but it doesn't even compensate the attitude we received.

One word to describe the staff from hostess to manager to waiter to cooks to busboy- INCOMPETENCE.   Place had at a minimum 5-7 cleaned and prepped tables open.  Hostess was so incompetent, she was able to maintain a long line of people waiting almost 10 mins at the entrance waiting to be seated.  INCOMPETENCE. My waiter had approx 5-6 tables.  He was unable to handle that light load.  I waited over 5 mins to place a drink order.  Easily waited over 5 mins for the drinks to be brought out.  Then waited an additional 15-20 mins to place the food order and receive the complimentary bread.  Every time I tried to flag him down, he'd say, "I'll be right there." but never came to the table.  This went on over and over.  INCOMPETENCE.   A full kitchen of cooks, but food easily took almost 30 mins to come out to the table.  Taste and quality of food?  Horrible.  INCOMPETENCE. As my table is eating, other tables finished their meals and started leaving.  The busboy was nowhere to be seen.  My table was surrounded by 8-9 empty tables piled with dirty plates.  As I was paying the check, the busboy finally came out and started to bus the tables.  INCOMPETENCE. The manager should know when a waiter or busboy is falling behind and failing.  He should then step in and assist as needed.  This guy deemed himself above doing any menial work and just strolled through the place doing nothing.  INCOMPETENCE. This place is overrated and overpriced.  The quality and flavor of food is laughable.  My table didn't touch one of the pizzas because it was just horrible.  Rest of the food was mediocre at best.   This is why my previous visit to CPK was well over 10 years ago.  I was forced to go by members in my party, and honestly I was curious how the food was now.  This visit once again reaffirmed CPK is overrated and overpriced.  I do know that I will never again spend my money at CPK.

I wish I didn't have to give it a 1 star because I have been coming to this location for years now but this last year there have been multiple reasons why this restaurant is below par!  The service is inconsistent- a hit or miss and today it was a miss!  The waiter was wiping checkbooks while our food sat on the counter waiting for him to pick up. We asked for bread 5 times and never received it. He even told us it was still baking when we noticed the two tables next to us all received hot bread.  When we asked him to check on the food we waited almost an hour for he said it was still cooking.  When the food finally came it was cold and the kids' pastas were hard and dry. We always order the chicken piccata and every other time lately it's not made to taste correctly. Today it was so cold AND THE ANGEL HAIR WAS AGAIN BOILED IN A CLUMP!   IT was so unsatisfying; It's definitely not worth $16.99.    We waited so long we ate what we got and hurried home to get the kids to bed but we are sick of having to complain to management. They need to get it right!

CPK is your  fancy pizza parlor if you want exotic flavors on your pizza, then your occasional pepperoni and cheese. They're quite well known for their BBQ chicken pizza, which is really good! Their servers are a hit or miss. Sometimes they're attentive and sometimes they'll forget. They also have free bread while you wait for your order!  Their pizzas are great, thin crust and quite filling for a person, that I usually have to take home. Their salads are great too. The right ratio of dressing to the salad. My only complaint is that the roasted garlic chicken pizza that I have come to love and frequently come to order does not exist! Even when it was on the menu, they ran out of the sauce! Completely unacceptable,  especially when there were three days left for it to be on the menu. That pizza will forever be missed. CPK is definitely a choice for hanging out or catching up with friends for pizza with an adventurous wild side!
I've always had such great experiences at this location. Love coming here with my family. The whole staff is great, I personally love Vivian!

This is a smallish location located in the very very busy Brea Mall. First the good: Friendly, sweet server Quick seating, even on a busy day Varied menu the order came out without any mistakes And the not-so-good: Grimey bathroom--you know, the kind you need to use a paper towel to touch ANYTHING in there... ugh... It felt too warm in there Sloooooow, overworked server Not enough dressing on the salad...ask for extra on the side WHEN you order. Doesn't feel particularly clean I ordered a the half (more than enough) Thai salad and my girls had pasta. Well prepared, large portions. The salad was underdressed, so I had to wait wait wait and then ask for extra. Our poor server was way overworked, it wasn't her fault the service was pretty slow. That salad takes forever to eat... I felt like I was chewing, chewing, chewing, and still had half a salad to go. Still, an OK sit-down choice in a big mall.
The service was a bit slow since the place was jam packed but when our server came he was friendly and enthusiastic. The food was great- we all got pizza and it was delicious. 100% would recommend!

It's been awhile since my last visit, and instead of pizza I ordered the California Club Sandwich with turkey vs The chicken.... Delicious, I love the bread. The avocado rolls are different than the ones at BJs but still good, I believe the chipotle mayo sauce was a good dipping sauce. Valerie was our servers long with another gentlemen. We were greater by 3 different host all polite as it should be. Thank you all.

Well unlike alot of other Yelpers who posted their reveiws about C.P.K., I actually experienced outstanding customer service from our Server. I just wish I can remember her name. I want to say "Jill?" She was a pretty, petite blond, green or blue eyes, who looked about 30. Very witty and so funny she had my cousin and I laughing out loud. She was very attentive. No complaints there. Besides her being amazing, our salads were delicious, tasty, fresh, and we didn't have to wait very long. The only downer was when the bill came. Who knew just ordering 3 glasses of wine, 2 salads, and a Lettuce Wrap Appetizer would come out to over $65.00?! What? INSANELY OVERPRICED for the portions you get.  I was very specific about which wine I wanted, but I guess you have to specify if you want the $7.00 glass or the $9.00 glass. Obviously, our server took it upon herself to bring us the "pricier" glasses of wine. Pretty slick, Jill. But that was my bad.  And because she had such a great personality, we overlooked it, and still tipped her very well. If only alot of servers out there realized, if you have a killer personality and great attitude, it's amazing what customers will overlook. (wink).  Would I eat here again? Probably, but I would make sure I ask for the same server as she made our dining experience very enjoyable. And I do have to agree with P.L.'s review about one thing, the bus boy we had was definitely not the brightest bulb in the Christmas tree.

Ok so if you have been to CPK before you know what to expect. I don't want to bore with a long review about a place you are familiar with so here is the skinny... This place gets packed but to my wonderful surprise we were seated within 15 mins when we were told 25! That was my first surprise. The second, and way better, was the change in the comp bread. They switched from kinda dry French and butter to a fresh delightfully crispy on the outside soft and yummy goodness on the in. Also instead of butter they now give olive oil with herbs. Funny how a little change like that can really revitalize the meal! We ordered two house salads and shared the spinach artichoke thin crust pizza. The salad was plain but good. If you don't like your salad drowned with dressing than this is the salsas for you. Mixed greens, tomato, croutons and light ranch. Next was the cheesy, garlicky, spinachy, artichokey, crispity crunchy goodness!! If that doesn't sum it up I don't know what will. This was one of the best CPK pizzas I've had to date. Service was great. I'm always a sucker for a real, not overly nice server and Sabrina was her! She was super fast, friendly and accurate. She kept my wine glass full so that is always a plus. She was also training someone but you would never have known bc she was so smooth and fast almost like a cheetah lol... All and all this location rocks and was my best CPK experience  of all time!!! I will def be back!! Thanks CPK!

I always like CPK, this is the CPK I go to the most mainly because it's the closest one to me. I'm really sad that they don't have the peking duck pizza anymore, but I like there Thai Chicken Pizza, BBQ Chicken, and BLT Pizza.  I love the salads here!! Love there BBQ chicken salad!! There other salads are good too, but I always order the BBQ chicken. There pastas are okay, but this is really not the place for pastas. Another dish I love is there Tiramisu!! I love the cream sauce they pour over it, rich, creamy, and very satisfying. Also there strawberry lemonade is really good too. Also all the CPKs always have great service. If you ever find anything wrong with your order, food, or service tell the manager and he will make sure to make up for it. Love the service here.  They have added a lot of new and fancy items to the menu, but I recommend the classics. If you are in the mood for a gourmet pizza in a causal atmosphere. This is your place :)

I don't even want to be funny in this review.. I swear the workers were all working in slow motion today. It took them a long ass time to get us seated. My sister even told them we were willing to sit outside cause they said they would be able to sit us faster. Didn't change anything.. was still slow. My sister had to go back three times to the front desk to ask them what was up with our table. Ok.. So then finally we were sat inside the restaurant. We ordered our food and drinks... and then we waited some more... Took them about 30 minutes to get our food to us.. COME ON CPK!! STEP IT UP! And we saw very little of our waiter after we got our food.. We all needed a refill to our drinks and he was NO WHERE TO BE FOUND. I was tempted to time him on how long it was till he came back to our table and give us all refills. But I thought that was harsh.. (and i couldn't find the stop watch on my phone.. haha). you lucked out buddy.. lol My food was good.. But it was ruined since I had to wait for my drink to be refilled. So all in all, this was a very disappointing trip to CPK.. We spent more time waiting then we did actually eating.

If I could give this review less than 1 star I would. I'm a regular at CPK and today I reviewed the worst service I've ever received. Omar was our server and he was terrible. Not only did he get my friends soup wrong, he never came back to check on us to make sure our food tasted alright. After we were done eating, we sat there for a good 20-25 minutes waiting for our check. We never saw him come by our table once and couldn't find him anywhere in the restaurant. I don't understand how a server can be so bad when it was at 2 in the afternoon and only 6 tables total that was occupied in the whole restaurant.
Good food and service! Went in on a Tuesday when they opened. Amanda, our server was great and the Garlic Chicken pizza was awesome. Will definitely come back.
Was here yesterday, food was delicious but the service was a little slow and they ran out of blue moon. Still 4 stars because the pizza makes up for it!

Called in and spoke with a host to make a reservation and they said they could only wait list me for a certain time and put me on the top of the list when I arrived. Arrived on time and they stated they were not able to seat me and put me back on the bottom of the wait list. There's no point to call in if they are just going to waste our time.

It's been a few years since I've been to CPK but I went last Sunday night for a friend's birthday party (well, a party for her 5-year old daughter).  I enjoyed all of the items we ordered, particularly the Waldorf Chicken salad and the Meat Cravers pizza, and thought the service was great.  (Note: we also ordered the Habanero Carnitas pizza which was good, but it had way too much kick for me!).  The waitress came by frequently to check on us and to replenish our water, bread, etc.  Things were a little chaotic as there were seven adults and five kids under the age of five, so this was much appreciated.  The waitress was also helpful in serving the birthday cake, which my friends brought from outside.  I will definitely consider CPK for a birthday party or group event in the future.

Went to CPK Wednesday around 1pm. My roommate and I were seated right away by a blonde hostess who was very sweet. The server, Paul, was very energetic( a little too much haha :) ).  Didn't get the bread for awhile so we asked for it and he brought it out. We shared the Spinach and Artichoke Thin Crust Pizza and HOLY CRAP... I looooved it :D spinach and artichoke are two of my favorite things! I recommend!  Overall I enjoyed my dining experience. I get how some of the servers can be a bit snobby, I've been to this location enough to just accept it. As long as they bring me my food and ask 'is everything tasting okay?' then I'm happy! Paul wasn't rude, he was very nice and sweet. NOM NOM NOM CPK :)
Zach made a lot of effort to making what would have been an average pizza afternoon to something else. Great staff all around

I would give no star if that's one of the option.  Last Saturday we had a group of 13 people going to CPK.  We purposely arrived before the rush hour at 11:30 because they don't take reservation.  When we arrived, the restaurant is more than half empty. When we asked for table of 13, the waiter asked us if we want to sit outside.  ( yes, when the restaurant is more than half empty, and when the temperature is almost 90 that day).  We told him we want to wait for seatings inside.  Regardless of the empty seats inside, we were told we need to wait 30 min. To get to seat ready.   Seriously CPK,  either the store management has a huge issue or this is some type of discrimination!

Just writing to let Yelpers know that they are not very friendly to accommodate large groups.  Went in early on a HOT Sunday morning around 11:30, our group of 14 was rejected to be seated right away.  We were informed that the only way to be seated right away is at the patio area.  Knowing they don't take reservations in advance (called days before) and half of the restaurant was still empty, it makes us wonder why we were ask to sit outside.  With the temperature to be at 100s and we had three small children in our group, how can CPK possibly be so inconsiderate?!  Maybe they just not welcoming large party with kids? Or our ethnicity?  I am making huge accusation here.....  So we walked away, no thank you, CPK!!!
Excellent food! We had the Thai salad, veggie pizza and it was great.  Complimented with great service . Very friendly staff !

This is my 2nd bad experience at this location once in December of last year and again last night 4/23/15. It's very close to my house and I won't eat here again. the staff is inattentive and untrained. the service is slow and terrible. one of the people in our dinner party found a bug (ladybug) in her salad and the kitchen manager thought it was funny and laughed at the situation. Our server Ashley was nice enough however very forgetful she brought 4 small piece of bread out when there was 5 in our party. I ask for more it never came until the food came out. I asked the personal who delivered the food for fresh ground pepper she said she would be back with it needless to say she never came back. In need of the pepper I ask my server Ashley which again never brought back the pepper. I order the Tequila chicken and there was two small piece of chicken in it.
Chicken picatta: sauce and pasta were wonderful, but the chicken was rubbery.  It was aviously frozen to pan. Would not recommend.

Pretty standard CPK located inside Brea mall.  The ambiance is nice, with dim lighting, great for casual dining after shopping or night out with friends.  We received okay service, our waitress wasn't very prompt, but not to the point where it got annoying.  I ordered the usual, bbq chicken pizza and my friend ordered the california club pizza. The bbq chicken pizza was delicious, as usual. Who knew bbq sauce would taste so good on a pizza? The chicken was very moist and flavorful.  As for the california club, it's a very unique presentation. It literally looks like  caesar salad on top of pizza dough, with slices of avocado going around the pizza.  It's something you should try if you like avocados and salad. The mix was surprisingly better than I expected.  Overall, I had a good time here, nice vibe, good food. :)

This is the worst CPK I've been to. The service on a Friday night was horrible. The host looked like she was annoyed with a dining room full of people and the server took about 15-20 minutes everytime he disappeared, and my husband and I were really hungry. We couldn't even flag our server down to request anything. I'll go to a different pizza place in the future.
Four Seasons Pizza enough said.

California pizza kitchen.  Cpk. Is a good place to eat. There pizzas are a little expensive for what your paying for but the flavor is on point.  Food.  The California club is just perfect. It comes with chicken, smoked bacon, and a bunch of lettuce on top of the pizza. The Sicilian pizza is also a must. For some reason every time I go to cpk I always order the Sicilian even if I don't eat it. Cpk use to have a tower of bread and butter which was perfect but now they have traded it up for a few chucks of bread and some olive oil and   Vinegar. Horrible.  Service.  The service is great. So far I haven't had a problem.  Overall.  I would return for sure. Food is great just pricing is a little extreme.

Ordered curb side to go.. Ordered kids bbq chicken pizza with a peach lemonade they put peaches on the pizza and forgot my lemonade.Also got avocado egg rolls they literally had nothing in them and were not cut..what the heck who eats peaches on a pizza!

Food was just okay. Service was awful. Our waiter spent the entire night hitting on a brunette bartender. Left us waiting for our check for 20 minutes. We found him sitting at a table with said brunettte, chomping on a pepperoni pizza. No tip.

Well the restaurant is located inside the Brea mall so parking is plenty. The restaurant  is busy  and you have to wait to get seated. So once seated things went smoothly the order was taken and we got olive oil with their bread. Then came my lemonade its acidic and sweet. Got their Quinoa  salad and the, Thai chicken pizza. The food was well cooked . Enjoyed the food you get automatic refills for the drinks. Had the tasty Tiramisu in the end, the food was wonderful. Must mention they have very friendly and superb service.
great pizza nice place awesome service

CPK has definitely improved their menu! Even the bread has changed!! (thank God) haha. Comes out warm & toasty, with a nice herb/Olive oil for dipping instead of butter like in the past. I most definitely love the healthier ingredients including more enriching greens in their CA Club Pizza. CPK doesn't normally pop up in my head when deciding on places to eat, but I can say that now it will. I also love their BBQ chicken salad with the perfect crunch of julienne jicama.. Yum! It comes pre-tossed with dressing. I normally don't like it that way because I feel like salads at all restaurants are just overly drenched with it. Luckily, my salad came out with the perfect amount; just right. Service is decent... Not spectacular but not horrible either. Will become a customer again of CPK after a long hiatus & this particular location will be my go-to.

Worst CPK I've ever been to. Start to finish: I  was there on my lunch break and the hostess asked if I wanted to sit at the bar. Said ok. Went to the so called "fast" area and sat for 10 minutes. 4 servers were in front of me talking, and I believe a manager. Tell me why they stared and didn't even ask what I wanted. HELLO?! I am a customer. One server finally went up to me and asked me what I wanted... BUT NEVER came back for what I asked for. I know this sounds a bit impatient, but if you're fully staffed, with not very many people around to serve, that is ridiculous to me. Never going to this CPK again.

What happened to quality? CPK is known for their pizza and ours came out burnt. Wish I took a picture but it was awful. Their other dishes were fine but I couldn't get the burnt taste out of my mouth. Won't be back that's for sure.

I went in for my free small plate and coke for signing up with their rewards program. I went up to the hostess stand and got sent quickly to the Take-Out station. Friendly staff! Got helped right away. The whole ordering process and pick up of food took about 5-10 mins! Delicious food! I ordered the Crispy Mac and Cheese Bites. Hot and cheesy! And it came with butter and two slices of bread! It was a nice surprise! Bottom line: If you crave a little mac and cheese and you're at the mall, get a order of the mac n cheese bites! It hits the spot!

DISAPPOINTED.  We were seated as time suggestedm. We sat and waited and waited.  No server came to acknowledge us or introduce themselves. Couple who were seated when we were had there orders taken and were served there drink order.  Two couples seated after us, the same thing drinks served and orders taken.  Still no server.   About ten minutes later frustration we get up and leave.  Really no one sees us sitting here.  On the way out we kindly let the hostess know about the situation.  We were given an ok sorry really.  No offer of speaking with manager or anything.   Not to worry I won't return here. i love cpk but this one will not receive my business.  Its to bad and sad to not be treated like a valued customer

it's pretty sad...but everytime i come to the mall, my friend dana will ask me what i'll want to eat for lunch/dinner and CPK will always be the answer. Im totally addicted to their soup and salad!  pros: -omg, their salads! their so fresh and delicious! i totally recommend the bbq AVOCADO salad. mmm...their chopped salads are really delicious too! -their soups! i like all of them! especially their tortilla soup, its very savory and not too salty -the service here, it's really phenomenal! cons: - im not a fan of their pizzas, their too expensive for what their worth! - hummus and pita, bleck!

When at CPK, one should definitely order what they're known for--pizza! My friend and I shared a pizza, since we both can't (and probably shouldn't) eat that much. So our order was 1/2 Roasted Artichoke and Spinach with Chicken and 1/2 Hawaii BBQ Chicken, but was given one that's 1/2 Roasted Artichoke and Spinach and 1/2 Roasted Artichoke and Spinach with Pineapple. (-1 star) It was a bizarre combination that even our waiter was confused. He mentioned that he went to the back of the kitchen to make sure that they got the order, but the pizza still came out funky.  I gave that 1/2 Roasted Artichoke and Spinach with Pineapple a try. The first slice was sweet combination, but the second slice didn't kick up the taste buds as much so I stopped eating and waited for my Hawaiian BBQ Chicken.  So... the moral of the story is, we got 2 pizzas for the price of 1, despite both of us didn't want to eat more than 1 pizza altogether.
