I am here to write about a certain employee named SARA, a hostess who I encountered to be very rude and disrespectful.   I Have eaten many times at this particular location and always enjoyed the food and staff.  However, today was an exception.        I was to meet some friends and their kids for lunch.  My two girls and I were the first to arrive so I went ahead and told the hostess, named SARA, that we would be a party of 11.  She told us she could seat us now in the patio or it would be a 20/30min. wait for indoor seating.  She had a little bit of an attitude at first as if she didn't want us sitting indoors.  Being that it was a warm day (in the 90's) I told her "let me text them and I'll let you know".  After my friends responded, I told SARA that we decided to eat indoors, and that my friends were about 10 minutes away.  She said that she needed at least half of our party to be present to seat us and there was another table that they were waiting to clear for our party anyways.  I agreed and thanked her.  I stood in front of her waiting patiently, about 10 minutes.  I noticed a few minutes later that another large party had arrived and SARA seated them.  Apparently my party was already there walking through the restaurant looking for us, when SARA approached me and told me that she gave our table away!  Is that how a hostess treats customers these days?  She clearly saw me waiting. When I told her my party was here she basically shrugged her shoulders and said "I can't keep another party waiting". Well, what was I doing, I believe I was waiting too?   I asked to speak to the manager but apparently there wasn't one available, only a kitchen manager, Christian, who at least was respectful and was listening to our complaint.  As my friend and I were expressing our concern to him, SARA was shaking her head and rolling her eyes.  She was even laughing for a moment after whispering to another employee.  My friend told SARA that this was not a laughing matter.  SARA's response was "How do you know we're even laughing at you?"      To the CPK manager in Brea....you need to rethink who you put at the front hostess area.  These people are the first employees that your customers are in contact with.  SARA not only needs an adjustment in her attitude but she also needs to know how to approach customers in situations like these.  If she would have come to me and tell me, "I'm sorry but if your party doesn't get here in 5 minutes I will have to give your table away".  That I could understand.  But to just give our table away after I've been waiting and then speaks to us in a disrespectful tone if front of the children?   SARA does not have the customer service skills or did not receive the correct training in handling a large party.

Came here for dinner and must say this is the busiest CPK's I've dined at. I had a coupon for 50% off that was going to expire the following day and couldn't let that go to waste!  For starters we ordered the small craving Mediterranean plate. Tuscan hummus, Feta cheese topped with extra virgin olive oil and a Greek salad with cucumbers, red onions, fresh Roma tomatoes and Greek olives in a homemade lemon-herb vinaigrette served with pizza-pita bread. I also ordered my favorite beverage here the Cherry limeade - it's so yummy!  For main entrees I ordered the Thai Chicken Linguine - spicy Thai peanut-ginger sauce with julienne carrots, green onions, cilantro and roasted peanuts and topped with fresh bean sprouts. This was very tasty but it was a little rich and heavy. In addition, we ordered Chipotle Chicken Pizza - This was so tasty - contained grilled chipotle chicken, fire-roasted mild chilies, chipotle sauce, Mozzarella and Enchilado cheeses. Topped with roasted corn & black bean salsa, cilantro and lime cream sauce.  For desserts to go - Strawberry Cheesecake and a piece of Tiramisu. I was full so I only tried a couple of bites that evening of the cheesecake and then polished off both the next evening. Both were very good but I enjoyed the strawberry cheesecake over tiramisu.  For being a national chain the food here has a variety of choices, good quality and service by our waiter was excellent.  I would definitely would come back to this location.

Came here while shopping at the Brea Mall.  My wife and I usually come here after some shopping. It took about 10mins for our waiter to come to our table.  Usually the servers here are very attentive but today for some reason the server was non-existent. I had to flag the waiter for some refills of our drinks.  The food came out after almost 20 mins which was unusual for CPK.  I had to ask when the food was going to come out at least once. The pizza my wife ordered seemed like it was sitting out for awhile and was not even fully cooked as it kinda limped like an NFL quarterback that just got sacked on 3rd down. The food and the service has been on a noticeable downturn at this location. Skip it and go to Cheesecake Factory or BJs down the street.

Great service. My server was Michael. He was really friendly, suggested add ons for my pizza because I'm picky and wanted to try something new. I will definitely go back. Kept checking up on my table to make sure everything was okay. Fab service.

I took my cousin to this location for her birthday and it was honestly the best service I've ever had. Our server Amanda was so attentive and personable. We ordered the bbq chicken salad and the works pizza. It was all excellent and served promptly. The manager Anthony stopped several times to see how everything was. It is so refreshing to see a manager be so hospitable and hands on. I will definitely be back and tell my friends how amazing everything was!

Went here on a Friday night thinking there would be a wait, but we got right in.  Now I know why. I ordered the Arugula Quinoah salad and it was honestly the most bland excuse of a salad I've ever had.  I decided to get it boxed to-go, thinking I could spice it up at home the next day, so the waitress offered to box it for me.  As she carried it away I noticed that she went to the cash register instead of the kitchen.  So she puts my plate down on the counter and proceeds to ring up her tickets, all the while my open plate being exposed to people coming in, babies coughing, other waiters using the cash drawer; all next to my salad.  Pretty sure that's a total no-no.  Don't ya think? Then to top things off, the bus boy bends over in front of our table, with his low-rider slacks, and totally moons us.  What a classy place.

This review is based off 1 time curbside pickup.  So I called in the pizza and was told 20-30 minute wait. I was already at the mall and thought, OK that's fine. ....so I waited 20 minutes, then 30 minutes, ....then 40, 50, 60 minutes!!!! When they finally delivered the pizza and I took a bite, IT WAS ALMOST COLD! They said they didn't know I was here. D: ...terrible. ...as for the flavors, they were delicious (Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage pizza) and I had to focus on the flavors and not the temperature as to not ruin my dinner from disappointment. Probably never going to do curbside pickup again. If I want that pizza another time I'll have to eat inside the restaurant.

CPK to me had always been about pizza... I always like to order and even customize my pizza with a honey wheat dough.  I didn't see it on the menu anymore, so I'm not sure if they have that option anymore.   In an attempt to stay away from pizza more recently in general, I struggled to find something else and tried their "Chicken Piccatta", a pasta dish with lemon flavored sauce and capers.  That was one of the most memorable introduction to a new dish I've never tried before.  Leaving with the craving to eat the same thing the next few days, I tried the exact same dish at three different locations that I frequented and was thoroughly disappointed.   CPK now shows me that they can do pasta well! CPK does chicken piccatta right.  Give it a try!
Katie is the best! Fast service for a busy Friday night. Love the bread and key lime pie.

New decor... New menu... Lack of service. Maybe it's due to the holiday but the service here definitely slowed down. I tried the new pizza called bacon and eggs pizza. This had two over easy eggs, bacon pieces, potato slices, and green onions. First pop the egg and the yolk spread to the other slices. This made the pizza taste unique and had an explosion of flavors   Thai crunch salad is one of my favorites as a light side salad. The peanut dressing has a good kick to it and I enjoy how refreshing the entree.  Overall, great place to bring your family and friends.

First time coming to cpk and the service was bad. When we got to our table we ordered a salad and had no utensils to eat with. Our waiter disappeared and we had to try to flag down someone else to ask for them. We waited about 10 mins. We though we might have to eat the salad with our hands. Finally got the utensils.  We ordered pizza and someone else brought it out to us and did not bring any plates. Also we never got anymore drink refills either. By this time we just wanted to leave. We were planning on having dessert, but due to the long wait we said forget it and go to Baskin Robbins instead. Waited forever for the check to pay. We had to flag down someone to get the damn thing. We felt like not paying at all. Our waiter all of a sudden shows up and apologizes and says he was too busy with a large table in the back. I don't care he basically abandoned us and all his other tables around us. He could of at least let us know he was going to be stuck with a large party, we would understand or he could have assigned someone else to assist us. 1 star for service Now thats out of the way lets talk about food. The food was Awesome. The salad had watermelon and strawberries and a champagne vinaigrette. It was sweet and delicious. The pizza was very delicious too. The flavors were popping.  5 stars for the food

Very disappointed with the food. Table next to ours was not cleared for the entire time we were there which was overly long due to length of time it took to get our food  - a salad with chicken and s turkey sandwich.

I will never go back. Our server Jeff was the absolute most rude and unpleasant waiter I think I have ever had. He walked right up to our table for the first time and very aggressively asked if we were ready to order....um, hi? Name? We ordered after he rudely mentioned they no longer had a certain menu item. He never checked back on us. We had to ask for everything: water, plates, silverware, to which he acted like we had just requested a million dollars. We would literally still be finishing a sentence while he walked away. I don't know what this guys problem was because we were nothing but polite. This guy needs to grow up and a SERIOUS attitude adjustment. Obnoxious. Food was average.
It is a bad service another brunch is better  I don't like that new stuff because Snappy The food is not like the steel I'm not recommend anybody go there
Hands down, Michael is the best!  Kung Pao Spaghetti with chicken and shrimp was delicious.  Great date night.

Love coming to CPK. No matter which one I go to, I can always count on the quality of the food being real good! I always get the California Club Pizza, however, I really need to broaden my palate next time. The last time I was here the bread was cut into thin slices made for my baby cousin and was served with butter. Now, they've put on some big boy pants and now the bread thickness is about double to triple what is was before, they dropped the butter and serve it now with a side of olive oil and seasoning. Pretty sure you can get butter still if you ask, as they still give you the olive oil and balsamic vinegar. The server was attentive, and even when he was busy there was always someone who came by and asked if we were okay. Once we were finished our waiter delivered our check and even started clearing some of the plates. Glad to still see mid priced restaurants with old fashioned hospitality, and not just leave all the plates until you leave. Definitely still a great choice for a place to eat weather you're really hungry or looking for something light. Best of all, you can shop right after since this CPK is located inside Brea Mall.

This is so disappointing for me to write because my whole family and I are big Cpk fans but this specific Cpk in Brea always does a fairly bad job with to-go orders  My biggest complaint is that the food is always super dry here  It takes me so long just to place the order to tell them not to be stingy with sauces and even then once I get my order the extra sauce on the side is never there !!!  Hope they get better to go packers so this stops happening, I always spend around 70 bucks for a few meals for the family and come home to so much stuff wrong and missing :( finally had to write a review

I know this place since I always go shopping at Brea Mall . However, I never eat here cuz I don't really like American food . When I went shopping with my friends yesterday, we thought about the Japanese restaurant next to it . But I wanted to try something new , so we chose this place . The first thing I liked about this place is their service. They were super nice , and they knew how to made their customers felt comfortable . I told them this was my first time , so they showed us what was popular here . They were super friendly . Next , their food was amazing . I ordered kung pao spaghetti and lime mojito . The kung pao chicken spaghetti was tasty , but it was a little bit oily for me . Their lime mojito was the best . I really recommend it . I really like this place : friendly service , delicious food and nice atmosphere. I will come back

I would agree with most of the reviews about the lack of service.there are two employees who have worked here for 5 years they are the only ones who provide great service. Thank you Amanda for always giving the best service. As for everyone else you are lacking in a basic hospitality necessity- service. The take out counter that I go to at least once a week is always slow or no one is there.
Great service and best BBQ chicken salad. Although I believe I dropped my wallet there tonight! Can someone please contact me about it!?
Food was good but far from great. Extremely stingy.  Service wasn't very attentive. Loud. I think we will stay with pizza if we come back. Lots of choices - most give a better value

Okay, to put a long story short we were given gift cards twice that had $0 balance on it. The first time it was $20 and they basically said sorry use something else to pay so we just left without taking the food we had called in for curbside. Well apparently the cards weren't activated when our Insurance agent bought them for us so CPK said sorry and just gave us three $15 giftcards as an apology. I tried to use it again today at Anaheim and they told us sorry it has $0 on all 3 cards. WTF!?!? We were LIVID. So I called Brea CPK (where it was bought) and got a hold of Jeff, the nicest manager you will ever meet in your life!!!! He was so understanding and just as frustrated as I was! He took the time to figure out what was going on (apparently when swiped the cards say $0, but when typed in it says $15, so bizarre!!!!) AND compensated us with a butter cake desert for the hassle! So lesson learned: beware of the finicky CPK gift cards, but ask for Jeff if you ever have any trouble! THANK YOU JEFF!!!!!

Horrible service. Do not recommend. We got seated and didn't have a waiter come to us for 10 minutes. Then we had like 4 different people bringing us our meals and water. No one checked on us in between. Here's the catch, We didn't receive any silverware or napkins. We sat there 15 mins waiting to see if anyone noticed. They didn't. After 1 waiter (Guy with mohawk) ignored our request for silverware I got up and grabbed them myself. On top off the terrible service, there were tons of flies surrounding us and on our food the entire time. I can't believe the manager didn't do anything. Never going to a CPK again.
Good (but sweet) cocktails. Thai chicken pizza with peanut suace is great. Good service at bar.
this place blows, customer service is far below par, this california pizza kitchen bowles nothing but gutter balls

First off I would never eat here, but it was for charity so I went against my better judgement. Did a takeout order it was supposed to be ready at 8pm but we stood inside the restaurant until 840pm. 40 minutes of standing around with no seating. The place was only half full so I don't know why they suck so bad. The pizza was very bland and service was terrible, but that's what we expected. Don't go here.

I've never felt compelled to write a bad review. Especially since I've worked in a restaurant for the last 8 years, I like to think that I tend to be more understanding when it comes to the service industry, but I've given this CPK three different tries and all three experiences were sub par. The food is good, but the service is lacking. First visit: we felt rushed out. Server asked if we wanted to look at a dessert menu when we were barely half way through our meal. (Unfortunately, that's not an exaggeration) and dropped the check immediately after, ignoring any drink refills while we were still eating.  Second visit: At first we thought the server may just be a nervous new server. (I know how it is) But after a while we just realized it was something else. He made us feel extremely uncomfortable the entire visit.  Third visit: We were hesitant to come, but thought we'd give it one more shot since we were craving their Chopped Salad. This time we waited 10 minutes at our table and no one came by to greet us so we left.  Unfortunately, even for a chain restaurant, they fall way short on their points of service.

my boyfriend and I used to always go to the location at the Anaheim garden walk. we would come to this location only when we would come shopping. it's always so busy but we get a seat in no time. the best thing recently is that our favorite server from the garden walk is now here! Kirby! she is so great! we love to come have dinner when she is working. she is awesome. very attentive and friendly and seems very interested in how we are actually doing :)

Lunch on Sunday, 1/25/15 I was visiting Brea mall and decided to have California Pizza Kitchen since it's located inside. There was no wait for seating although it was lunch time during the weekend. The hosts and server were all friendly and had smiles. Service was great with just enough time to decide on our lunch items and Jesse, our server, came to check up on our refillable peach lemonade and root beer periodically. We started off with sourdough bread and olive oil. It was delicious compared to the original white bread and butter they used to have. For our entrees, we ordered the salmon and Chipotle chicken pizza. The salmon was not dry and was served with a corn salad. The pizza could have been spicier and perhaps a little more saucy. Aside from the minor details, both dishes were good. I would order the salmon again but try a different kind of pizza. I would definitely recommend this place.

Stopped in on the weekend while the family was shopping, looking to order some food to-go. After grabbing a seat at the bar, I was greeted by a bartender/server who was not having a good day. I ordered mac n cheese, a salad with grilled chicken added, and a Thai pizza. The chicken for the pizza was absolutely burned, and wasn't ready when the rest of the food was. The people next to me ordered the same pizza, and received their food before me. Pretty disappointed, wouldn't spend another $ there

Our waiter Steve was very professional and friendly. He interacted with small talk. Even though he was nice, the service was non existent. I had to flag him down for water, bread, etc. He checked on us when he was serving food to the table next to us. He didn't ask about the quality of our food and/or that we needed anything. He even didn't up sale by asking us we wanted dessert. I would of order it, if he just simply asked. We had to wait for a togo box after he gave our bill. The table next to us was getting irritated because of his non existent service. He didn't even say "Thank you have a good night and come back soon."  For whatever reason, the service was horrible. Now onto the food. The Pesto Cream Penne was filled with oil. I drained quarter cup of oil from the plate. The Jambalaya Fettuccine noodle was hard which was undercooked.  Overall, my dining experience wasn't pleasant especially the service.
If there's a zero, I would give it to this branch. Been seating for more than 20 minutes and we just got served. Sooo bad!

The hostess (two young girls) were RUDE and not helpful whatsoever. Our waitress was rude as well (young girl with glasses)! It was not busy that night but she seemed as though she was rushing us to order, eat, and pay. She picked up one of the guest's chairs while they were on it and moved them by saying "Excuse me, just gonna move you," just so she could wipe the table!!?!?! The food was good though.

This place is hit and miss with both food and service quality. I usually like their Thai chicken pizza, but tried the BBQ salad once and the chicken wasn't thawed, which makes me think they don't use quality ingredients.  We usually sit at the bar and there's one guy who is really friendly and has great customer service. Then there's another guy (Asian with goatee and tattoos) who doesn't seem to know how to smile. Overall, not terrible, but will only go for convenience.

I love CPK. It's my favorite place because of the chicken piccata .. But I had a horrible experience here and it sucks even more bc I live right around the corner. My pasta was sooooo salty I couldn't eat it.. I love salt too... But it was bad. Then my glass of wine had 2 fruit flies in it at the bottom. So it must have been the bottle.. The guy was kind of nice about it but you can tell he probably thought I was such a brat for my complaints but I just couldn't eat my pasta or enjoy my wine... I'll go to a different location from now on

Came here because the line at Gengis Khan was too long. We were seated right away and our drink order was placed. the server came back and took our wine and food order. The food came out first and we almost finished our food before the wine came out... By that time there was no point to drink wine with our meal if our meal was already finished.  I had the chicken garlic fettuccine pasta which was alright. The noodles weren't cooked all the way and I had to crunch my way through a few noodles. My boyfriend ordered the tequila lime pasta which was a very interesting twist to italian pasta. I have never tried anything like that before. We ended up switching out dishes back and forth until he finished both of them.  Service here is alright, a little slow. Customers are funny, we were people watching and the table next to us said their Kendall Jackson Chardonnay was corked, which is impossible with a Kendall Jackson wine because the cork is plastic. That was the highlight of my meal..

The birthday boy wanted CPK for lunch.  Seriously???  Ok just because it's your birthday. Our party of 7 ordered several salads and 2 pizzas to share family style because that's how we roll at work.  The food actually wasn't bad.  It's the damn service that royally SUX.  Wait staff is inattentive.  One of the guys wanted a to go cup for his drink.  Waiter never showed up. My coworker finally got up to search out the waiter after we paid our bill and the waiter said he's too busy and to ask someone else to help.  Dude, isn't that your job and why you get a tip.  Screw that..never patronizing CPK again unless some numb nut at work decides he or she wants their bday lunch there.  EEK!! Methinks not.  EVER.
Horrible curbside service. Did it once never again. Generally speaking bad service overall

I can honestly say that this was a horrible meal. I worked for #CPK almost 4 yrs and love the food. I know they change the menu often, but tonight it was nasty my stomach hurts. The waiter was pleasant and his mgr came and took care of both bills (two parties at the table). I was insistent on paying it, but she didn't want me to. Even though my BF was the one complaining. That was nice of her...but that BBQ pizza  use to be my favorite (not anymore) the pastas were dry as I don't know what  #badexperience #pizzawasnasty #drypasta #thanksstephanie

This was my second visit to this cpk and it was pretty good. Not as good service, but is definitely still come back: Food:  Avocado egg rolls- to die for!! They have a decent portion of avocado, and you dip them in chipotle ranch. (Unless you're boring, they give you a side of ranch also ) oh and THEY HAVE BACON!! So good! Sourdough bread and Olive oil- this is complimentary. Addicting for sure, much better than bread and butter  Chicken tequila spinach fettuccini- so damn good. So flavorful. I come just for this pasta. The fettuccini noodles are of spinach so that's pretty cool if you wanna eat a little better.  Service: The hostess sat us right away and was so friendly and accommodating.  Our server was nice too but she wasn't very attentive. We waited for a while with our glasses empty before she came back so we could ask for a refill. It seemed like she paid special attention to the table next to us and so that was a little frustrating but  all in all cpk gets a four stars from me for this visit. Had the service been just a tad better, it would have been 5 stars for sure!

We will give the whole experience 4 stars, could've been five but the waiter totaled ruined the entire done in.  Food: delicious, pear-gorgonzola pizza just perfect.  Hostess: very attentive and nice Manager came to our table and was marvelous with superb customer service skills..  Waiter: totally rude, threw out coasters across the table, took forever to take order, attend our table, and bring food out.. The actual manager had to bring our food out and the place was lonely.

Beautiful smile, great customer service.Jasmine is our server. We are falling love with this place deeper and deeper. This CPK makes us feel like coming home to mama for dinner. After meal we talked to Jasmine, and she is not even the waitress, she just do the take out and host. We can't imagine how great will she be as a waitress. Thank you Jasmine for taking care of us.
Good place to have your Pizza in this mall. Fast service , good test.  Will come back here again.

CPK Has definitely gone downhill over the past few years.  EVERY time we come in, something is changed. They got rid of my favorite items (BLT pizza, and chicken corn chowder -- they got rid of the soup like 5 years ago, and the pizza within the last year or so). This located just updated it's look, it's very random and doesn't match a Pizza Kitchen. The menu no longer focuses on pizza, they added steak (random?) more pastas, seafood more appetizers, new soups (potato bacon, etc) tacos and other random items. The pizza crust doesn't taste the same. The service was meh, Although the Hostess was FANTASTIC! Not my favorite place anymore, it used to be, but they are trying too hard to be something they are not.

Great  customer service, friendly staff,  awesome manager that handles the restaurant very well. Ordered the halibut, yes they have fish at cpk, delicious, I was impressed. Tasted fresh. And if you love mac and cheese, they have a great creamy mac and cheese for kids

First time here was on my sons birthday. It was his choice since we go to the Brea mall a lot and always pass by CPK. We went during lunch time and everything was delicious. They even gave us a complimentary appetizer of cheesey bread which was delicious. And since it was my sons bday they gave him an ice cream sundae with a candle. Lunch specials were reasonably priced and the service was great as well. We will return for sure.

I have to give this place 5 stars!! When we first arrived, there were 4 lovely young ladies to greet us, and my baby boy was in love. Lol  They say is and right away they took our drink order which I greatly appreciated because it was 100 degrees outside so naturally I was feeling really thirsty. Then Scott, our waiter took our order and he was on point. He was fast, attentive and never skipped a beat. My husband didn't even ask for a refill and he brought one. Super brownie points.  Everyone was great here. I have to take the time to recognize their hard work. No on to the food. -Whole wheat pita w hummus- Delish! I love it with  the extra checca  -Waldorf salad- I like it without the Gorgonzola cheese. To each their own. -tequila chicken fettuccine- I get it w less oil. It was light & yummy in my tummy. - mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza - above par.  Everything was wonderful! I'll be back here

My favorite spot. My cousins and I went a couple weeks back during the holidays. They went for their first time and I go as always. They loved it just as much as I did. I love that the mall is right there too. Even though the mall was super busy so was cpk and the wait time wasn't that bad either.  The only other location I feel can do way better is main place mall including their servers.  Our favorite drinks is the Moscow mule made by Brandon at the brea mall. Thanks

Tequila fettuccine is my favorite. And the chipotle pizza. Everything is pretty good here. Simple interior, nothing out of the ordinary. Comfortable setting to eat with friends or family. There's a lot of choices and when you're done eating, you can go walk around and shop!

uhhhh.... I think never again. The server was great but the food took 45+ minutes to get to our table we ended up taking the order to go. Then we got sick from the food after eating it at home. Not a good experience at all

I have been here twice now. I got a pasta the first time and the beet salad the second time. The food is mediocre and kinda pricey in my opinion. I really dislike the service here. It always takes so long to get the check and for them to bring utensils I don't know why they always forget.

My coworkers and i ordered the  full portion moroccan and roasted veggie with salmon salads, very yummy but not enough for the price. They don't offer the same exact salads at cheesecake but any salad at cheesecake is twice the size of ours for the same price. Don't expect bread and butter here either. I ordered the cran cooler and got a glass of club soda with a pinch of cran juice for color. The waitress was attentive she came by to check on us a few times but never got a refill - my glass was empty for a while I even forgot about it until it was time to leave...if you want pizza or specific dish come back if not hit up cheesecake instead :)

What a joke!!! Sat and waited and waited  while looking at six empty tables. I haven't seen such a poorly run reservation  desk as this. I guess you can chalk that up to poor management. Either the desk girls are poorly trained or not terribly bright. I don't mind waiting but won't be waiting at this restaurant ever again. There are to many other good restaurants in Brea. Went to Cheesecake Factory it was fabulous. Great service over there!!

While the food is kinda expensive, it's definitely worth it. CPK is a great place to take a date or to just have a nice dinner without totally breaking the bank. Be prepared to wait a while on peak times, like Friday and Saturday nights. There's generally about a 20-30 minute wait, even for just two people. The restaurant itself is very nice, but a bit small. An unfortunate side effect of the smaller size is that they have a number of "half-booths" that have spots for two people on a shared booth and two more people sitting opposite on regular chairs. You get the table to yourself, but these are located incredibly close to other tables with the same layout and so you'll wind up sitting nearly right next to another party which sucks. There's hardly any room and definitely no privacy. I would highly recommend asking to wait for a booth. This will add to your wait time, but will make your dinner much more enjoyable. Consistency is a huge selling point here. I don't think I've ever had a bad meal and the service is always great. The waiters and waitresses will hang out for a second to make sure you've got everything you need and will chat a bit (but not too much) if you start it off. Having great customer service is definitely a priority at this location, and it shows. Appetizers come out very quickly, and if you haven't tried it yet you absolutely need to get their spinach artichoke dip. It is absolutely amazing. Make sure to ask for pita bread on the side (don't have them replace the chips with it), because that makes an already awesome appetizer even better. Main courses sometimes take a bit to make it to your table, but I've always been kept up to date by the waiter or waitress and I've rarely had to ask for a refill of my drink. I've had deserts or other small things comp'd on my check if I had to wait too long for something, always without having to ask for it. The outside dining was recently converted to allow it to be enclosed (thing BJ's patios) and they have numerous portable heaters so you can pretty much eat outside any time of the year. There's this odd sewer smell coming from that area of the Brea Mall (not coming from CPK, but somewhere in the parking lot) which can make this undesirable. CPK is one of the few restaurants that I actually enjoy tipping well at. I get great service and am incredibly happy to leave great tips in appreciation. The quality of food and service is almost unmatched, and I really like coming here.
Expensive and one of the smallest "large" pizza's I've ever ordered. The Hawaiin Pizza was very bland.
me and my husband went here for an evening dinner. very friendly staff. even had the manager come out and ask us how the food was. great place to eat in the brea mall
Dependable service.  Consistent quality.  Great prices... Just wish they had a better beer selection... Came by here today for lunch with a friend.  I had my favorite: California Club Pizza~

This location is found in Brea Mall. Usually I'm at the mall to shop, but on occasion I've stopped here for lunch. When you just want quick service and good food so you can get back out to the shops, this isn't the place to go. They always seem to be pretty crowded and slow. The food quality isn't great either. Never was a huge fan of their pizzas and other items. I'd rather grab a quick bit at the food court or Nordstrom Cafe.

This place made me very unhappy. There were eight of us all together, all of our food was brought out at different times, by the time the second half of our party got their food, the other half was done. The waitress came to our table 4 times total and we were at the restaurant for 3 hours. I would not suggest this California Pizza Kitchen.
Not bad, Excellent Lettuce Wraps is a must get! Kids menu can be better. 4 Star.

You really have to already be a CPK connoisseur to enjoy this meal.  I am sorry Brea Mall, but you are trumped by Fashion Island any day.  Even Laguna Hills has some ambience!  If it's pure craving that you must have a CPK meal, you'll be alright.  Don't go on a Friday night if you're hungry.  The staff is nice, but the wait is not.  I don't think Brea did research on Feung Shui to authentic CPK dining.  This kidney bean sized restaurant does it's best but lacks the lustre.  They tried.  I don't want anyone to get too excited when they see the CPK sign.   P.S. I ordered BLACK OLIVES, not LACK of olives!
This place used to be great. However the food has been a little off these days. I used to come for the bread. I hate the new bread. It is so hard that it should come with a dental plan

Service was ok she kept my drink filled but she brought my son the wrong pizza but we did not say anything. The Caesar salad kind of sucked limp overdressed. The pizza was not good either it sounded good but it did not taste good it was pear and hazelnuts. I used to love this place but my last 2 times were not up to par.

I personally love this california pizza kitchen compared to other ones. The service is generally great. I love their honey wheat dough crust and bbq chicken pizza.  The Tomato Basil Spaghettini is pretty good too, not sure a lot of people would like it though. It kinda has a strong italian herb/garlic flavor and i really dislike garlic but i think it tastes really good. The chicken in the pasta however lacks flavor.  THE RED VELVET CAKE IS SO GOOOOOOOOOOOOOD. Just had it yesterday and it is now my favorite dessert. It's so moist and the frosting is superb. Too bad it's so expensive though for one slice = $6.29

I love this place, but....... yes, there is a but..... way too many commas, haha. But, they got rid of my freaking Carne Asada Pizza!! Why would you get rid of something so awesome? I don't see a replacement for it on the menu and I guess I'm gonna try the Chipotle pizza. Other than losing the reason for coming here, the foods always good and the service is great. The one thing kept on the menu that I'm still happy about is the avocado egg rolls. Gotta try them!

The last time we came here was over 1 year ago.. you see.. we were seated... and then we waited, waited, waited some more and before we knew it, 15 mins had passed by and not a single soul came by to take our order... seriously  15 mins is a long time at lunch... the people next to us, which got there before we did, also still had their menus and just sat there for god knows how long.  so we got up and left... on the way out the host said thanks for coming by, and I told her that we didn't even get a drop of water... cuz our waiter never came.. and pointed out that the polite people that sat next to us are still sitting there and there was no waiter.. if the waiter was on a poop break then they should have sat us where the waiter was not on a poop break! I refuse to go this CPK ever again!  I would give 0 stars if that was an option.

Yum, delicious and filling. A great go-to place for a satisfying meal. My family, friends, and I especially love the flavorful Hawaiian barbeque chicken pizza. All of their pizzas are tasty and they serve quality pastas as well. The shrimp fettucine is a favorite. No matter what you order, you'll always leave CPK a happy camper.

I had CPK for lunch today and it was just alright.  I had the bbq chicken salad and my little sister had the buffulo chicken pizza.  Both were just alright.  The waitress was nice but i dnt think i would return.

A review for people needing Gluten Free options: We haven't been here in a few years and recently got a gift card.  It seems like they have suffered from strong competition like Zpizza, pie-ology and Blaze for a while.   My wife is 100% gluten free so we both eat gluten free lol.  Ordered two gluten free pizzas.  HORRIBLE.  The worst GF dough i have EVER had.  Spongy & tasteless.  We returned them immediately. It seemed this place is paying more attention to their decor than the food. I got a regular pizza (not GF) and it was same as it's always been (blaze is better IMO) Two stars for good atmosphere and good service.

The kung pao spaghetti was soooo delicious!  Love the flavoring of it.  Slightly spicy but not too much, with a hint of sweetness and a little bit of sourness.  Just bursting with flavor.  We got it with shrimp.  The shrimps were plump and juicy.  The pasta was cooked just right.  Tender with a bit of a bounce to it.  Overall great texture and flavor.   The gorgonzola and pear pizza was also good.  It was on a thin crust pizza.  I would prefer it to be on a regular hand tossed crust since I like the breadiness of the pizza crust.  Also, I like cheese but not too much of it so I think a thicker crust helps balance out the cheese better.  The caramelized pear slices were sweet and delicious.

After a long day of shopping, it's convenient that they are located in the Brea mall. Our server, Brandon was so nice and helpful in suggesting different plates and setting us up with a "pizza dough" card. We decided to order the dumplings, lettuce wraps and a margherita pizza (all our favorites). Wasn't disappointed, everything was very good.

The upside of this place is that the service was spot on, from the host to the waitress to the manager who came to check on us. There were also a few interesting dishes that we had a lot of trouble choosing between since they all sounded so good. However I was really, really disappointed with the pizza when it came out. I got the "original hand tossed" variety, called "The works". What came out was an extremely flat pizza that looked like something I might buy frozen at a store and make at home. It was the size of most personal pizzas. The variety of ingredients on it made it pretty tasty, but I honestly cannot justify paying almost $16 for the pizza I got.  My boyfriends pizza was the "thin crust" type and literally was SO thin that it looked like they cooked it on a tortilla. His was also almost $16.  I do believe in quality over quantity, but I honestly don't believe anything we got there was worth the inflated price.

I've been here quite a few times before, I like the food a lot and is the closest to where I live. I'm giving it a 1 star because it has been multiple times that something comes up and they either ran out of certain things of the menu or is delayed a ridiculous amount of time. But mainly this review is because I've noticed in every holiday season they definitely cannot handle a full restaurant, they scramble like chickens with their heads cut off. They need to anticipate for the amount of people on a busy season and need to have more waiters available. I won't be coming here again.

I have to say, been here multiple times with family and friends (separately), couldn't have been more satisfied with all visits.  I have to say it's not going to beat the experience and taste of a real Italian pizza from my travels, but I have to give hands down surrender to CPK for satisfying my belly when I crave. Parking...well you have to fight with the mall rats. Restaurant is always clean. On one occasion, under the table was dirty. I'm assuming someone was too excited and got their area nice and greasy. The wait can be non-existing or sometimes 30-45 minute waits. Price is good for the quality and quantity of food. FYI the pizza(s) may seem small, but you get full trust me (or maybe not...).  Can't seem to remember anything that upset me there. Thank you for the service and consistent quality of food and delivery.
Food was great but moreover the manager Stephanie was super helpful and apologized for the mistake during our dinner.  Regardless of the mistake they took care of us and we enjoyed our dinner.

Ask for Cyd (cydney) assuming her name. Great server great attitude.  Granted everybody here is very nice and attentative. Ordered artichoke spinach garlic thin crust pizza added red bell peppers and chicken . Fresh mozzarella hand shredded on top of pizza . I had speghetti Kung pao added fresh shrimps and for $4 extra, well worth it for I believe 6 fresh shrimps,  very fresh ingredients,  spicy oil chili sauce  very authentic for non Asian restaurant oh my, sat there eating and sweating!  Peanuts galore, green onions and red bells. Yummolicious. Get the hand shredded mozzarella on top! Service was incredible,  with ever flowing iced teas, and great service all around. Lastly the dessert.  S'more pudding & vanilla bean ice cream,  yummy.  I would have liked a little more sauce on the pizza,  very good flavors,  just not enough sauce.  My opinion the shrimps could have been either bigger or a few more.  Thanks CPK.   See you soon Cyd & Tracey one of the managers!
This cpk is always short on staff and takes forever to seat and take orders! So annoyed.

Kula Sushi across the way had a 30-45 minute way and CPK only had a 15 minute wait. Well, that 15 minute took about 35 minutes AND we were seated at a table in the bar area (I thought bar area was free seating)? There were plenty of empty tables so I assume they were short staffed. The staff were all hustling, including the manager, Amanda I believe as the tables on either side of us were visited by Amanda and our table completely ignored. Michael, our server did his best given the circumstances. We ordered our food, pasta- I forgot the exact name. It took about 45 minutes!!! to come out and tasted very salty. The table next to ours both go the kung pao pasta, took one bite and sent it back to the kitchen. Their server said that the lunch crew oversalted the pasta and that they got lots of complaints. We suffered through our meal as we were hungry and wasn't about to wait again! Overall, very upset about the amount of time spent here AND to top it off, not enough time to shop at the mall! Boo.

Quick service on Valentines day. Glad we choose this restaurant to dine in instead of Olive Gardens or Red Lobster. Service was just okay by Jasmine. We've actually been here before when it's not crowded so I know how great the service can be. But yesterday we didn't get any bread while we waited like some other tables did. She would check up on us but she wouldn't come right next to the table. Since we were seated next to others and there's a small space in between she would just walk by behind my date and ask if we needed anything. Instead of doing what the waiter next to us was doing for his customers.  I still enjoyed the food just wished we would have gotten better service.

CPK is everywhere. But they are not all the same, because a restaurant is judged by not only foods and service but also customers. I love this CPK particularly since we feel we can enjoy the foods after excitements of shopping and walking around the mall. This is one busiest CPK you can find; even you may need to wait in a line before you can be seated. Is it worth waiting? Totally :) I love the manager of this CPK, who sometimes comes in and ask if everything is ok. Small thing, but you can earn business in that way.

Located on the second floor of Brea Mall, this is a great place to come after doing a little bit of shopping done and get a bite to eat because you are defiantly famished from doing all that shopping !  So I now love how they have this cute tiny menu with little small appetizers. :) I have tried the asparagus and arugula salad which is great. Love both and they have a great taste with this combination. The dressing is light and not overbearing. Something that you should try out.  The service is nice and if you want to get some bread you should ask for it while the server gets the water. One of my favorite salads to eat is the Asian one and the vegetable salad. :) Also if you want something that is pasta I did enjoy the portabello mushroom ravioli. But it isn't one of the best places. But all this food really isn't comparable to traditional Italian places! Just something to munch on if you are at the mall and starving hungry.

I'm very upset because of the fact that this restaurant used to do so well and now it's almost to the ruins.  CONS: -VERY slow service. Our waiter was oblivious to the fact that his purpose is to serve his customers. We waited more than 10 minutes for our water to be refilled. I had to practically flag him down. We went around 3pm where there isn't a lot of customers.  -the food is very salty. Jambalaya is known to be on the saltier side, however, the sodium amount was way too intense.  -we ordered the caramelized peach salad and that salad was anything BUT a salad. It was absolutely ridiculous. The salad was completely withered and did not look fresh. This salad was a definite NO. Ingredients were not fresh. It was disgusting.  PROS:  -I can't seem to think of any, which is sad.
I love the charity the restaurant offers, but tonight's waiter was missing the mark. Slow on everything. Weird attitude too, once you are bad, just get me my food, don't get cheeky.

Had lunch at CPK.  The host was very nice and very informative.  The restaurant was clean and we received prompt service.   The pizzas were good.  My guest ordered a pizza with a gluten free crust which apparently is a pretty new thing for CPK.  My guest said that his pizza was very good and shared with me that gluten free stuff is either really good or really bad.  He finds that very rarely is gluten free stuff  mediocre.  CPK has done well with the GF crust.  He said that is has a sweet taste to it and complimented the sauce very nicely.   I enjoyed the pre order bread and olive oil.  It was a classy touch. The one thing that I can't stand and this goes for a lot of restaurants is charging $2.89 for a soda.  It absolutely drives me crazy.

Food is ALWAYS good here. Pretty on point. But every time I'm here, waiters are either inattentive or service is incredibly slow. I came at 3pm on a Friday and the restaurant was mostly empty and it took almost 45 minutes for our food. Again, the restaurant was almost empty. Only like 10 tables were filled. We never saw our waiter, Joe except for when he came to take our order after waving at him for 10 minutes. Other waiters were walking back and forth a lot with plates but ours was nowhere to be seen??? He never came around to refill our tea or water. He was just invisible or something. I have the impression that they're kinda understaffed and waiters have to take care of too many tables. Just disappointed per usual with the service. Took forever for us to get our check like I needa go shopping. We asked him for the check and it took another 5 minutes for him to get it to us. Literally don't know what's happening. Sooooo disappointed.

Came at one of the busiest hour (7PM Friday night) yet we were seated right away. Server was quick with our bread, water and drinks. Amazingly quick service! We were in a hurry (needed to go shopping for a wedding) and he was very accomodating! He brought our food quickly, the bill, togo boxes and change was brought to us right away.  In terms of food, I ordered the usual stuff I always get: fire roasted chille, chicken wrap, roasted veggie salad, california club pizza and white corn guacamole.
Nice service . good food . awesome drinks .I recommend the halibut  awesome plate . Butter cake was great ....  Yummmmm...

Amanda was awesome!!! We haven't been here in months and she remembered my brother and I, what we had to drink and where we sat. Every time she helps us she is extremely welcoming and friendly.  Food: 3.5 stars Amanda guest service: 5 stars!!!  We'll definitely be back.

Sometimes you can see how a good restaurant is going into the dump. This is one of those places. I used to love this place 5 years ago, but they have made so many changes for the worse that I avoid this place. Some examples, the waiters don't bring you bread anymore, ask them twice and they still pretend to forget. They have changed the menus and have removed some great things ( mushroom ravioili is one example ). Couple of months ago, I ordered their tostada pizza ( use to be my fav ) and I was served this burnt up thin crust pizza, totally different than the pizza it used to be an year ago. It was so burnt up that I could not eat it. Most of their pizza are now average quality. This has become just a boring place that keeps getting worse in terms of customer service and food.

The 2 stars is really for the manager who helped us out. She's blonde, wears glasses, small tooth gap & extremely nice and positive. But the hostess (always has a damn flower in her hair, and her hair is too big for her head) who I have encountered several times is rude. Walking up she would just stare at us, not even a greeting or a smile, just a blank stare.. And another time we came back with a buzzing pager and she again just stared at us. Really?! Her job isn't hard at all to greeting take a name hand out a pager and sit people.. Even when she sat us down she stood in front of the table and made us go around her (you really couldn't move to the other side!?) Next out waiter was decent he hustled and made sure everything ok but their new uniforms he was dripping in sweat, had a sweat collar and sweat stains it was a really big turn off to the food thankfully someone less sweaty brought out our food.. Overall I'm not satisfied with the hostess who is the first impression of the restaurant she needs to go.. And so do the jeans and blue button ups..

Mmm, our waiter was pretty good.  But, the bread they brought us was cold and hard along with the butter. I had the BLT pizza with  the honey wheat crust.  So delish.  My only complaint is that I couldn't eat it all, but I did ask for separate containers to put the lettuce and tomatoes in.  hopefully the lettuce won't wilt before I get a chance to eat it.  My dinner partner had the tostada pizza.  She was starving, she had no pizza left. I performed a taste test and its really good also.  All in all not bad for being in the mall.

I wish I could afford to be a regular here. The service is always friendly. I venture to try a new pizza everytime. Today was spinach and artichoke hearts... yum! My group always shares salad and pizza, great combinations.
Very bad service. Had to ask for refill on drinks.  And food was cold.

California Pizza Kitchen A.K.A CPK *sigh* LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! out of all the chain restaurants I think this is one of my favorite places to eat.  My girlfriend and I love this place without a doubt.  The service here has always been great!  And the Menu has lots to choose from.   Food: California club pizza, Jambalaya pasta, tequila chicken pasta, Jamaican Jerk pizza, Thai pizza, BBQ pizza, mushroom stuffed ravioli, cheese bread, artichoke dip, Asian Salad, etc. ALL BOMB! MY FAVORITE IS ACTUALLY the Jamaican Jerk, and California club.  Can't go wrong with those two.  Price is not that bad.  10-13$ pizza *well worth it* and pasta just about the same price.

CPK is getting to be like McDonald's with branches in virtually every area in the US and even abroad.  The specialty pizzas that used to taste unique has become extremely commercialized (with frozen pizzas found in every single supermarket.)  Their efforts of adding new ethnic entries is commendable and falls short.  (Kung Pao pasta taste like a bad version of lo mein that cost $5 in Chinese restaurants)
I went here for lunch yesterday with a friend.   We were able to be seated right away and the server was very attentive.

After being a broad in Nippon for some time, my good friend Buddy B. is back stateside. The first (and arguably only) course of business is to fatten him back up on delicious diverse food as only Southern California can provide. His second stop with us today was: California Pizza Kitchen, for california pizza. The pizza was okay. I had a 5 dollar glass of fucking yellowtail to wash it down. And our waitress, Lindsey, was cute. That's about it.

i loveeee CPK.  I go all the time and have never gotten anything I didn't like. This location is a little difficult because it is in the mall and normally in the evening you encounter a bit of a wait. However the service is  really good and at least you can walk around the mall while you wait.  I most always order the Santa Fe Chicken Pizza (minus the chicken) on honey wheat crust with a peach lemonade. It has scoops of guacamole, sour cream, and salsa on top with caramelized onions. Doesn't sound that appetizing now that I think of it, but it's delicious. Also the Veggie Pasta or shanghai noodles are fucking great. The Miso Salad is soooo good! normally I hate ordering salads because I feel jipped when I'm done, but that's not the case with the Miso Salad.  It's sorta pricey but for what you get I don't think it's bad at all.

My biggest complains about CPK, is their cold, dry and flavorless breads. You would think they'd have good breads to serve, considering how much pizza dough they make daily, and all they needed to do was simply bake up some of those doughs, and they would have been so much tastier than the stale white breads that they currently serve.  Almost everything on their menu are reasonably priced, and the tastes are very consistent. My favorites would be the Shrimp Scampi Pizza on a honey wheat dough, Shrimp Fettuccine with Garlic sauce, Kung Pao Spaghetti and Grilled Vegetarian Sandwich. I've had their Lettuce Wrap as well, and it was nicely portioned but way too salty for my taste bud.  All in all a nice restaurant, and I would definitely give CPK a 4 starts only if they jazz up their complimentary breads.

I've often had excellent service at this location.  I love pizza's so this was my favorite place when i needed a break from dorm food.  When i was having a bad day, there was an employee that worked here that often cheered me up.  When I went down to so cal to visit a friend, we had dinner here and  tried to  find him; but i don't think he's working there anymore . . boo!! but still got great service though.

The birthday package is awesome for the price and location.  The kids get to create their pizza and have a tour of the kitchen...much cheaper than Young Chef's Academy.  We started the party at 10AM so that we had the restaurant to ourselves.  Normally, they open at 11:30AM.  Lisa, who was the coordinator, did an awesome job in making sure the kids were engaged and having fun.  They even supplied the party favors at the end even though we had some for the kids already (i.e. aprons, chef's hat, and treats). I can't believe they give the birthday child a CPK apron to keep which is included in the birthday package! My kids loved the party!!!  Thanks CPK! :)

Never disappointed at this location. Service is great, servers really hustle. Today we had Thomas and he was very professional. My husband and I always have a salad and share a pizza. The food is excellent, however today we could have used a little more salad dressing. We should have asked, but didn't, for more. Coffee is good and I really like the new bread they are serving, with olive oil.
YUMMY!  Hubby, babygirl and  I went during lunchtime.  Got seated right away.  Great service and food!  Will come back!!

Good chain, bad single location. Maybe because all the other ones are so good this one stands out as such crap. The service is especially bad. The food on many visits was very different, bad different. This location just seems like some CPK knock off. If you want good food, good service, I recommend going across the parking lot to cheesecake factory

Went there last night; been quite a few months since last visit.  Small samplers were good priced; had beef tacos (med spicy, flavorful, came 2 to order), wedge salad (good & hard to mess up), crispy Mac & cheese (nice crunch but seemed to need more salt on the inside); also got blt pizza & 2 kids meals ( Mac n cheese & BBQ chick pizza). Good sized for kiddies. Food would be 3.5, but service was a .5. Server guy said ice tea was unsweetened but actually was (sugarfree DOESN'T mean unsweetened ...); was observer to iced tea on his tray tilting ever so slowly that it finally spilled ... right on the customer's purse; extremely slow service (this was probably due to him having tables not all centrally located - booo to manager!); and messing up on the free desert that was to come w/kid's b-day meal.  With the slightly higher prices and having to request bread, this visit was somewhat disappointing.

My girlfriend has celiac disease  and was excited to see that they advertise Gluten Free pizza in the menu. However, as per the manager, they no longer have that option. I ordered a bowl of  pea and barley soup. The bowl was big, about 11 inches in diameter. But it had a 2" rim, meaning that the actual holding area was only about 7" in diameter. The soup in the bowl was a little over 1/2 inch in depth, and there certainly wasn't much barley floating around. It was way too watery. A very meager portion to say the least for $6. I have to wonder what the $4 cup looks like. My girlfriend ordered the BBQ Chicken Chopped salad. The waitress messed up and brought the half size order that cost $9.  It had a very small amount of chicken and was rather blah with iceberg lettuce. We were suppose to be happy it cost $4 less than the full order. The waitress brought my soup and asked if I wanted pepper. I said yes and then she went and attended to another table. By the time she returned the soup was half gone. Had I waited, it would have been cold. The service was sub par and consisted of excuses  and misinformation. I liked the variety on the menu and contemplated many return visits; but in the end we decided to never return!  Upon leaving I noticed the guy at the next table and he had a smaller bowl of soup and as expected it was only half full. It just doesn't seem right to pay full fare for miserly portions. Fill the freakin' bowl!!!

If you are looking for soy free or gluten free options, Mauro the manager here is awesome!  He went to great lengths to individually check every single ingredient in every single item and make sure my wife could eat what she wanted!

One of the better CPKs around.  The service is usually responsive and accomodating.  The food is generally quite good.  I recommend the Tequila Lime pasta.  The honey wheat bread for their pizzas is tasty. The worst part is the bread.  Its cold and cardboard like.  Don't even bother eating it.  There can be long waits for seating because its in the mall.  Overall, nice place to have a simple meal.

Terrible service. Wish I can give it less than a star, ordered catering dish and the thought it was a si ng le entre order when I got there. I waited by the bar for an hour for them to finish the catering order and then they charged me twice for it on my credit card. On top of that the pasta was undercooked and the sauce was the constancy of milk. Avoid this place like the plague.

We had Michael as our server for most of our meal and he was wonderful. Smiley and attentive we were happy to have him! Only giving three stars because of the server who started us. He came up and asked if we had been greeted (after siting there for ten minutes with no attention), we said no and said, "oh ok. What would you guys like to drink? Are you ready to order?"   If that was a "greeting" then someone needs to teach him manners. He didn't introduce himself or anything and didn't offer refills. Michael came along just in time to refill our empty drinks and turn our experience around. My only concern is that no one in the restaurant wears name tags or even matching shirts, WAY too casual, there was no uniformity and it was difficult to tell who actually worked there and who was a customer.

Cool app, great food....terrible management of the delivery service! We ordered food at 11am this morning for a 2pm office meeting today. We were notified at 1pm that they had already cancelled all of the deliveries for the rest of the day. 1 hour notice gives me no time to plan another meal for our meeting. Our end of year party for our employees is ruined! Thanks Brea CPK Management! Even though we have successfully used your service before and have always loved your food, we can no longer trust your organization and refuse to order from you again.

Favorite things to order: -BBQ Chicken Salad -Spinach Artichoke Dip - a little bit salty but I still like it -Sedona Tortilla Soup -Portabello Mushroom Ravioli -Chicken Tequila Fettuccine - My husband orders this every time. -Grilled Vegetalbe Salad - Avoid this.  Way too many calories for something that's "healthy-sounding" -Oddly, I don't like any of their pizzas.  They crust is too thin for me. -Many of the pasta dishes are too oily for my preference.  Feels like an oil slick on my lips after I eat them. -Service is hit or miss.
I tried their curb side service for the first time . It was great food was great. Their California club is delicious.

Ok, lets make this simple. service was okay. inside the restaurant  was okay. food was GREAT.  I came here on a regular day, between class time with my bf. We had some pizzas, since the place sells mainly of pizzas.  I was curious about their jambalaya. I never tried it, but i always wonder how it would taste. So we ordered it. The Jambalaya is pretty good. Its a bit spicy and you can tell it came from the New Orleans side. overall its really good. but i wouldnt order it again.
Pesto creme penne was not cook completely, (hard) . I guess what do you expect from CPK . I'm sure there's other meals in the menu that they can't mess up or can they?

First time at this location and the service was very mediocre. Jaz is a terrible Waitress. She is inattentive and disappears  a lot. We asked for bread and never got it. Asked for extra plates and never got it. I needed a refill and couldn't find her for 15 minutes. Same thing happened when I needed to ask for my check.  Also, our frozen lemonade came out with huge ice chunks because it wasn't blended properly. When we pointed this out to jaz, her response was to stare at it and say "oh okay, really? Then do you want a different one?" No apology or anything. It was super awkward.  Ask for a different server if you come but I suggest going to the anaheim gardenwalk location
Our favorites r tomato basil pasta, Margherita pizza (thin crush) n mushroom n spinach flatbread. Their tiramisu is also very good! Actually everything is very delicious!!!

I've gone to CPK at various locations every once in a while for almost 20 years.  So I was pleasantly shocked today when I found that they replaced the cold sourdough sliced bread & butter with fresher warm & soft thicker pieces of bread that comes with a tasty oil-based dip with little green stuff.  It may have even been freshly baked but I am not sure.  I had to ask, and the waiter said this was indeed a recent change.  This type of complimentary bread was good enough to request 3 sets to eat.  It helps a lot when one is hungry and waiting for pizza or when one pizza is not enough to eat. I find that joining their email list and getting occasional coupon offers that you can stack with gift card use is a more economical way to enjoy CPK.  Costco sells $100 worth of gift cards for $80.  The CPK web site had a Black Friday deal in 2012 for $40 free gift cards with purchase of $100 gift card also.  I justified such a large purchase back then thinking I would give four $25 cards as gifts, but then decided to keep them because I think I enjoy pizza a lot more than the average person.

Just had their pear + Gorgonzola pizza, Chinese chicken salad, and pesto cream penne with shrimp.  First, the pizza:  Very, very good! Cheese, baked pear slices, and diced caramelized onions on their thin pizza bread, topped with some hazelnut pieces, fresh romaine salad, and Gorgonzola cheese... so good! The salad: With two people, the half size salad was too much! It could have fed 3-4 people.  The pasta: Also very good! Pesto cream sauce, penne pasta, and sun dried tomatoes.  It was fairly busy when we went, but there were several waiters running around, so we didn't have to wait for attention. Nice staff and fast service.

My brother & I headed to this CPK yesterday & let me tell you, this location is a great one! Food was delicious & service was excellent. We had a server by the name of Cydney & she was very quick & efficient. Super friendly! Will be back soon!

Let me start by saying this was my first visit to a CPK and they just made a life long customer!  I work here at Brea mall and went up for the lunch special.  The food was amazing,  definitely more food than I expected for the price!  Not only that but the manager on duty treated me so nice and made me feel so welcome!  Thank you so much for an amazing meal!

Yesterday at CPK at the Brea mall. Ordered two pizza's one of the pizza was cold as if it had been sitting for a while and handed to us. When the server came to us asking if everything was okay my wife told her that her pizza was cold compared too mine. The server said I am sorry let me check. Than after few minutes came the Manager asking if everything is okay we said one pizza is cold. He said he checked with kitchen manager and the pizza came right out of the oven so there is no reason for it to be cold and walked away. For rest of lunch the manager never came to our table but all the tables around us he visited at least 3 times. It costs us $40 for two pizza's which was worthless . Did not expect this!!! The manager needs to learn how to deal with customers when they are telling you about the food.
I love CPK! I love their CPK pizza & pasta & salad! :) This place is pretty big so you don't have to wait at all. The service is good & workers are friendly!

I love the staff here. I always sit at the bar,  because this location is always crowded and busy. The staff at the bar are extremely friendly and helpful. The location are busy, but they still manage to help us sitting at the bar with great service. They also have really cheerful and funny employees, too. I also love the food they have in CPK: it range from pizza to pasta and salad or even just to fill up your sweet tooth. They have a great selections of salad if you are considering something light for your belly. They are now serving mini appetizers if you want a grab a small bite. Highly recommend and high suggest checking their seasonal specials: you will be surprise to discover some delicious dish exclusive for that season!
Jeff from Colorado is a nice guy! Appreciated his humor and service Same as all other CPKs. Get a salad with that pizza to make yourself feel better.

It's CPK... It doesn't reinvent the wheel or do anything you don't expect- it's your standard CPK.  However, like most chains, some are definitely better than others.  Maybe my expectations were lower because this was a mall location, but it ended up being a very good experience.  The waiter was prompt and friendly- once he saw that I wasn't going to turn down a refill, he didn't even bother asking, just kept the drinks coming. Food was good, exactly what I hoped/expected from a CPK.   Seems to certainly be one of the better CPK locations around Orange County.
Ashley is the best server ever! She Is very nice and pleasant! Come with kids or your husband stop between shopping! They are all very nice!

I went to this location twice already, and the service is horrible. U get seated at a table quick but then left alone for a while... I keep giving cpk a chance to make good food, but something is always wrong. The pizza turns out dry, there soups r cold, there sandwiches r cold, there salads r sloppy and flavorless. Not to b hating but if anyone knows a great cpk, plz inform.
Had dinner here last night.  Always a nice, satisfying menu.  Easy to find something reasonably healthy.  The Waldorf salad was really good!

My boyfriend and I are big foodies and love eating at places with great staff. We had a waiter who made our experience awesome. He cracked jokes with us, made sure we had everything we needed, and made it feel as if we were at a friends house for dinner. The food was good but the waiter made it great.

Pan-Sauteed Salmon with Lemon-Caper Spaghettini: deeeelish!!! Would have given this location 4-stars if it wasn't sooo dusty! They could bust out the Swiffer duster every once in awhile... just sayin'!
I like the pizza and noodles!!  I usually only visit here with family members so it's been a long time now ....

Ordered curbside last night for the first time. It took about 5-6 minutes from parking and calling, but that's way cheaper than the $10 delivery fee.  Split a ginger chicken dumpling, kids bbq pizza and chicken caesar focaccia sandwich with a friend.  My only disappointment was that the kids meal comes with a drink, we picked water, and we never got it with our order. Sure, it's only water... but it's supposed to come with the meal.  The ginger chicken dumplings were yummy, a little spicier than I could handle but I really have ZERO tolerance so that's no surprise.  The bbq pizza was fantastic, as always... I really like their frozen version at grocery stores, too. The focaccia bread on the chicken caesar sandwich is delicious but they really doused the dressing on to the point where it became soggy and was dripping.  We'll be back

The food at CPK regardless of location has always been decent. The wait at this location can get a bit lengthy on weekends since it sits inside the mall. The service here is friendly, but the waiters/waitresses need constant reminders regarding refills for drinks, more bread, more butter, please bring olive oil and vinegar, we need x boxes, and we need the check please.  It's like they're way swamped and can't remember what you asked them 2 seconds ago because they're trying to remember what the last customer requested. A downside on the food is that they often run out of ingredients.  They run out of clams for their baby clam linguini, they run out of eggplants for their vegetarian and eggplant pizza, and other stuff...

I ordered a salad with salmon on top. What i got was over fried and crunchy salmon.. on top of that, it was cubed into several pieces!.  on their menu picture, shown was palm sized filet of salmon.. what i got was totally different.  I asked the server if this was how you guys always serve salmon? He said, yes.. it's easier to eat.  For some reason, i just don't buy it.  I've ordered similar dish from other restaurant and never ever got cubed salmon in my life.. until today at california pizza kitchen. Maybe that's how they serve it, i do not know, anyone with different experiences? Great pizza tho.

I visit cpk after a long day of shopping for my first time ever.  I was greeted with the best server ever her name is Kayla she was bubbly, friendly and very knowledgeable. I love spicy food and she suggested the best choices she also told me about there new summer margaitas and they were great.....I cant wait to go back hopefully she will be there, I will definitely ask to be seated with her.  I wish more servers were as nice as she is.  She made my experience and my night.

If only it was bigger. Ambience: Big well known food chain, it's always busy, a bit loud, and lots of families - and I mean A LOT of familes. This particular CPK is in a mall for crying out loud. I've been here a few times and upon walking into the restaurant I can always hear a baby crying somewhere. Granted, I get it, they can't help it. But still...Feels a little bit like a Chuck E Cheese, not exactly a date location. At least not this specific one. And what is UP with the layout of this restaurant, it's so awkward - long and narrow. Narrow spaces and babies don't mix well. Yummy: Bravo on their new Small Bites menu. More so, new small portion dishes adds more variety to your meal instead of the standard "pizza". Which by the way, is scrumptious as well. Vegetarian options are a plus. Service, could be much better... just because its a major chain that people will go to, doesn't mean they should lack at service. It seems like a mission to find your waiter in every visit.  Rating: Wouldn't be so high if it wasn't for the food. Gosh.. the food. Always a pleasant taste.  Unfortunate: If you're hungry and ONLY hungry. Double think coming here - parking is a battle.

I would give no stars if I could. This was the worst restaurant experience I've ever had. Our server Ramon was a complete jerk. We asked for water and he gave us dirty looks. We got plates that were unwashed. The place was half empty when we got there and they gave us the worst seats which was right in front of the entrance and the cash register. Even when we were ordering he was looking somewhere else and not at us. I usually like california pizza kitchen but I will never come to the one in Brea ever again.

Talk about a long wait to GET your food!! They seriously take forever for a side order of cold chicken and some tomatoes (special diet don't ask). Granted its a Sunday but we waited 45min for our food! Ill be going to a different CPK for my CPK fix!!

I liked the sauteed onions in the goat cheese pizza. It seemed safe even for the lactose intolerant. The waiter warned us that their crust is already thin so if we wanted it thinner it would be like a cracker. I love the pineapple colada and we ordered two fried artichoke hearts but I've liked Tam o'Shanters version better. The sauce was only tartar, not special.   I wish I knew I had to ask for bread. It's a good way to kill a couple of hours while waiting for the Apple Store to get the day's ipad delivery.  I've never tried any of the pastas though.  My experience would have been perfect if not for the two women nearby speaking in baby talk to a toddler. Our waiter seemed to show up for our order after someone went to the bathroom.   He was thoughtful enough to include a glass of water with my drink.  The wait for a table was only a couple of minutes.  The restaurant was full. They have Pepsi instead of Coca Cola. We didn't stick around for tiramisu.
We had Mo as a waitress and she was amazing! Service was great, got our food fast, love this place.

Worst CPK ever (Brea mall), sat on a spilled drink cause no one cleaned up, no silverware - waitress forgot. Soggy Chinese Salad, pizza dough not cooked thoroughly, pissed off employees dirty place and dirty dishes. Stay away..!!!

CPK here used to be generous with their servings. I remember their salads when buying a full plate used to have SO much in it, now it's like getting a half plate while paying for the full plate. Their pizza is alright. If you're will to splurge for pizza, come here. But I think I'd rather splurge next door at BJ's or Cheesecake Factory... The Waldorf salad is really good. Well, before it was. Last time I had it (last week) it was a little off...

It was our first time here and I must say I was pleasantly surprised with the service and the food. The hostess, the waitresses and even the supervisor were so genuinely nice and even acknowledged our first visit by giving us a free appetizer! We will be going back for sure!

This CPK can be a hit or miss...one time i experienced horrible service where our server never checked on us like refills etc and the other where our server checked on us at all the right times even offering to warm up my soup since i ate my salad first when she brought both at the same time...the staff for the most part is friendly and the wait has never been too long

This was my boyfriend and I's first time trying the curbside service. We made it the exact time the lady told us to come. We called and notified them that we were here. The gentlemen stated it would only take a few more minutes. As we waited in the car...25-30 minutes passed..We decided to go inside and check where our food was. They explained that the last dish (pasta) was still not ready. We werent in a crazy hurry so we didn't complain or anything. It took maybe another 15 minutes and finally our food came out. The manager came out and apologized to us and gave us the pasta for free~! =) The staff was very professional and handled the situation very well. The food was great! And they gave us free refills while we were waiting.  We ordered: white pizza, alfredo fettucini w/ shrimp & chicken, and korean bbq tacos. All were very delicious!!

Went on a busy Friday evening with my family. The wait was about 45min long but it's worth the wait. Service here was good, the waiter came about 2min after we sat down to get drink orders. By the time we got our drinks, we were ready to order our meal. I forgot our waiter's name but it felt really nice when he got me a 2nd glass of my Italian soda without even asking when I was almost finishing my first glass.
