For food, we started with Dynamite Shrimp, then ordered California Club pizza and Kung Pao Spaghetti. The Dynamite Shrimp is lightly fried and had a nice chili sauce that was just slightly spiced. I've had California Club before and it still feels interesting to have lettuce and avocado on a pizza. The Kung Pao Spaghetti was my first time trying and it really impressed me. I usually don't eat spicy food, so one was really really spicy to me, but I still couldn't stop eating it even as my mouth and lips were already feeling the burn.  My dad scoffed at my orders at first ("Why are you ordering Asian dishes when you can eat them at a Chinese restaurant."), but I like the Californian spin on the foods that we're used to that they do here at CPK.

GREAT PIZZA....BUT SMALL PORTIONS & LARGE TABS I should start by saying this place does live up to it's reputation, it has some amazing pizza...and it has small portions at a ridiculous price.  Do I recommend it? Yes, definitely worth a try and I promise you will love it, but you might not go every day given the portions and their prices.  So they offer a large variety of pizzas (and other stuff too but who goes to CPK for anything but pizza let's be real). They have pizzas with every topping you could think of and some you didn't think of. They offer toppings from the obvious choices like pepperoni, vegetables, sausage, etc. to more surprising toppings like avocado, lettuce, scallions, tortilla strips, corn and even some crazy sauces like ranch dressing, black bean salsa, lime cream sauce, and mayonnaise. They have some very unique creations like the Chipotle Chicken with enchilada cheese and salsa, the thai chicken which has tortilla strips, the pear and gorgonzola, or the works with spring salad. And of course the list goes on and on, but the main point is that the only original thing here might be to order a simple pepperoni pizza, if they let you that is. So the first time I went here I got the Hawaiian bbq chicken pizza which was amazing and a half! It comes with bbq chicken, fresh pineapples, green onions, and red onions on normal crust. The pizza was amazing, the only downside was that it was a personal pizza that did not fill me up and that alone was over $10...so yeah kinda disappointed to some degree.  Overall some amazing pizza I definitely recommend anyone who has never tried it to go here at least once, just go in knowing you are going to pay high prices with smaller portions.

This place has been going downhill over the last couple years. I generally do not come here and only will come because my wife has a coupon or my mother and her limited food choices wants to come here. The Thai Chicken pizza used to be my go-to but the last few times I have been here its been inconsistent and not as flavorful as it used to be. The service is hit and miss but I would more attribute it to them packing the sections as densely as they can without hiring more service staff.

We had a great server but that could not make up for tired Banh Mi Bowl ($15) my girlfriend ordered. The lettuce and some of the other veggies were old. She took out the old stuff and ate the rest. Some were old, like the mint and carrots, because they were cut too long ago and some were just old old like the mesculun which was shriveled, yellowing with black edges. We showed the server and she said the manager would be coming by but no one showed so we paid and left. She apologized and offered dessert on the house, but we were full of Thai pizza which tasted pretty good to me.

This place is neither great nor terrible.  I frequently order take-out from this location when I am at work.  Usually everything goes okay with the exception of timeliness but if this facility receives any to-go orders that are more complex or bigger than just one or two people each or they have a catering job then the entire process is a disaster.  I don't know what the deal is but it seems they simply do not have a sufficient system worked out to handle anything more complex than someone picking up lunch for themselves.  The entire staff is discombobulated when having to deal with orders like that, seemingly no matter how much advanced notice they have.  And if you are ordering one meal for yourself to go and they get a big order then be prepared to wait.  A long time and with zero communication.   Additionally, if you order online the website gives you a very specific time for pickup and the order is usually not ready at that time.  So if you are in a hurry or only have a limited time to pick your order up because you are working then I would not recommend coming here because you're probably going to be late.  I have waited from anywhere from 25-45 minutes for a to-go order from the time I was told to arrive.    I come here a lot--at least two or three times per month for the last year or so, so my review is not based on one or two experiences, this is how it is 70% of the time.  Luckily I'm on salary. If I weren't then I'd never be able to eat here.  The staff is *usually* friendly but frenzied.  They really need to find a way to more efficiently deal with pick up and catering orders.   The food is good and prices fair enough but efficiency is a major pain point.

The food is good here.  The worst are the restrooms. There isn't any toilet paper in all of the stalls, and paper towels are all over the floor because the trash can is over flowering. The restroom floor is wet and the sink area is also wet. Their restroom is not a good place to go to.

I use to love CPK back when they hit the trendy pizza scene and would even wait in the long lines for it but with the competitive food explosion these days my taste buds and wallet are very content especially with all the build your own customizable pizza joints that taste just as good if not better at half the price plus saving on gratuity.  The food is still good as I remember, my gripe and reason behind the 3 star review is in regards to their gratuity system.  TIP: CHECK AND CALCULATE TIP YOURSELF!!!  Notice in my photo attached that the suggested gratuity percentages are based on the grand total of bill not the sub-total which is illegal!  They cannot tack tip on state tax.  They are not the only restaurants doing this and hopefully it is a systems oversight that they will adjust based on sub-totals.  Everyone has devices with calculators these days, do a little double checking or you'll find yourself giving away extra money here and there which eventually adds up.

It took 30 freakin min to get some napkins after eating oily bread. I had to ask countless times, and I finally got the napkins when I got my food. Did I mention that I didn't get my water until my food came out too. "Shaking my head" #lasttimeigothere
There food is too greasy and heavy.  The shrimp scampi pizza was soggy and had too much lemon.

Let's not drag this review out . Let's just say Filthy and dirty. Workers looked puzzled and confused when I asked for them to clean the filth on the floor and table . Waiter with the shark fin hair was nice  I raised my review rating on this only because the company reached out to me . First time a business actually cared.

The food was decent but the service was awful. We waited 20 minutes for a refill. Plates were left on our table while the staff just gathered around the kitchen and ate. I asked to speak with the manager. He was nice and apologized and offer a free cheesecake. I didn't accept it and didn't have anything compt. All I wanted was to express how bad their services was. I will not come here again.....
Jeff and Oscar, best services CPK! Great food and very friendly! Jeff brought over these very spicy but very delicious peppers! Thank you for the great lunch experience on our shopping break!

Eh CPK. I used to REALLY like it, but now it is just alright. I don't think I can justify the price anymore because how okay it is.  I usually get the tostada pizza. This time around it was just okay, kinda over done so a little burnt. The crips on top were still cripsy this time so that was nice! Other than that, just okay. I added lime chicken, mistake. Not really worth the price, it was cooked okay, a little dry, not that limey at all. The service was great though! really friendly people, and quick seating cause we called ahead. So definitely props to that.  If you are a fan of the food/your dish, definitely go. The only thing i didnt like is their food cause its not as good as before and too pricey.
Delicious food, great service and amazing dessert!  The salted caramel pudding was so good!
This place is amazing! The staff is always nice. Brandon and Annie Jo always go above and beyond for me. It's much appreciated!
Great staff... the pizza and the rib eye were amazing. Luckily the wait was mere moments on a saturday night.  Our waiter was amazingly attentive.. thank you zach
The kitchen is messing up orders. The servers are good though. The portion is extremely small for the price.

These people are idiots ! I had $10 pizza dough and a free birthday dessert Cpk gave me for my bday. I got the order to go and i asked the girl can i use the 2 coupons together and she said yes. She gave me a total far larger than what it should be and then she said i dont remember saying u could use both coupons. Girl u need to lay off the weed cuz its interfering with ur life at Cpk! Then she couldnt do simple math and nor could the grounchy manager named Brandon. No apology no nothing .then she just kinda sits my to go order next to me and says Nothing. Nada . Zip. No thank you no sorry no nothing. Never coming here again.

I used to like their food but not any more.  They use re-formed processed chicken and it's terrible.  Today, everybody wanted to go there so I ordered the fish tacos trying to avoid the chicken.  The tacos were tasteless and the fish dry and overcooked.  How can you mess up fish tacos?

Had a great time at CPK for my son's birthday dinner. I was worried because he turned two and this really isn't your typical place for kids, but he really like pizza. I had the half order of bbq chicken salad- can't go wrong, all the elements in the salad work in harmony. I like the lime wedge on the side to give it that acid. My wife had the pesto penne pasta with chicken. Past cooked perfectly and just the right amount of sauce. Sun dried tomatoes, Edamame, and Chicken also worked in harmony. My son had the cheese pizza and apple juice. Pizza was good and we received a free ice cream sundae for his birthday. Our server was attentive and kept our waters filled.  Also bread and oil were delicious.

Everything was great. I ordered Bolognese Spaghetti and it was wonderful. Portions are large and cooked perfectly. If you are in the area I recommend giving it a try. I don't think you will be disappointed!!

If I could give zero stars, I would have! Usually I'm very happy with my meals from CPK, but today literally took the cake. Cold, hard pizza and what was almost a slice of key lime pie . Just horrible...well, 1 star will be for the potato soup...it was amazing. It will be a long while before they get my money again..trust and believe

Ordered a Full Thai Crunch Salad - They gave half as much as other CPK's do.  Hardly any actual greens.  Saw bits of spinach, arugula, etc - which never comes in this salad at any of the other CPK's.  Way too sweet, carelessly put together.  (Big blob of sauce and toppings with greens here and there)  Waiter claimed the only thing he could do was charge extra for more cabbage, lettuce, etc.  Hurried service all around - waiter would be asking us questions and speaking to us across the room and while walking away.

Came here with a group of friends last Saturday for dinner. We sat outside which was cool.  The food here is overrated and over priced. All of the pizzas and pasta are AVERAGE.   We started with artichoke dip and chips which the dip came out lukewarm. Seriously? How long was it sitting out? And also an order of avocado egg rolls. Don't even think about comparing this to Cheesecake factory's scrumptious avocado rolls.  We ordered a tostada pizza, chiptole chicken pizza, greek pizza?, and a couple of pastas. AVERAGE. Nothing stood out.  Our server could've been more attentive to us. We had to ask for bread after like 15 minutes. C'mon man, show us some love. Overall, an AVERAGE dining experience.

CPK used to be one of our favorite chain restaurants.  We like its innovating and constantly updating menu items.  The food items deserve 4- 4.5 stars.  But my affinity toward CPK has been tempered by inconsistent service and long wait time for food.  For this particular location, there was one occasion where the hostess was downright rude toward an elderly family member - to be fair, that was probably an isolated incident.  Otherwise, I wouldn't say the service is bad, but it certainly leaves more to be desired.  One quite a few occasions, it took a long time for the server to come over to the table after we were already seated, and then the server basically did not come back for water or follow-up throughout the meal despite empty or half empty glasses.  Another issue is the wait time for food (not for table) - while we know this is not McDonalds, the average wait time for food has been consistently (and at times unbearably) long compared to other similar restaurants. We usually ask for the complimentary bread when we order the food, and one time we were told that bread was not available because the bread slicing machine was broken... seriously? Maybe another isolated incident.  I don't think there is anything wrong with the service standard from an institutional standpoint, but too many isolated incidents of bad /mediocre service certainly can have the potential of leaving a bad taste in a diner's mouth.

This place gets really busy on weekends because of all the traffic from the mall. The food is good, but I've had better food from other CPK locations. The service is sometimes spotty. It is hard to get the attention of a waiter sometimes for something as simple as wanting more bread or napkins. I am a vegetarian so I was pleased with the number of options available, especially after substitution. I like the tostada pizza and the chipotle chicken, minus the chicken of course.  The pina colada's are good, but the mai tais were not so good.

Waited 40 min for a pizza and pasta.  WTH Jeffrey?  And when he saw we were displeased, he tried to tell us they seated 5 tables out on the patio at the same time, swamping him.  That could explain slow service, but not food coming out 40 min after we order.  Besides, we left through the patio and there was 1 seated table.

Ok service, but really trying to up sell us on the water. We say we will take two waters, she says oh now did you want the Perrier or the other fancy one...really upselling me on water. Common now.. if this is MGR who pushes this your RIDICULOUS. Also since when is a personal size pizza worth 13+ dollars... I only came since I had a gift card and wont come back to spend my money on these over-priced pizzas. They are good, don't get me wrong, but over priced as HELL

Awesome service especially because it was super busy on Valentine's Day! Thank you Edward!!! Fast, efficient, and delicious food! The chili rellano is awesome and is on the lighter side! Yum! Will definitely be coming back.

Had lunch here today with my parents and baby nephew. We were seated in the patio area. We shared the meat cravers' thin crust pizza as my parents noshed on the petite wedge salad with bacon and bleu cheese as I had the half salad of the thai crunch. That was yummy! I'd order that again. Great addition to Brea Mall since we spent the rest of the afternoon here before picking up the rest of the family at Disneyland.

Good place to eat after a day of shopping in the Brea Mall. Lot of seating, the wait is never really too long.  Great service. Tip: You now have to ask your server for bread; they don't give it to you automatically.  The Thai Crunch salad is really delicious and fresh.  A full order, or even a half order, I suppose, could be a tasty lunch.

Awful.  The name made me think the food was going to be trendy and good, but it was bad.  It lacked flavor, and I left hungry. This is an over priced chain.  When other good places exist - why go here and be unhappy.

My sister and I could not decide where to eat while we were shopping at the brea mall but we wanted to avoid the food court at all cost.  On our way out, we passed by the California Pizza Kitchen and decided to give it a try.  I've only dined here a couple of times but I remember the quality of the food was good both times and once even the manager came out to greet us. This time was no different.  Still good food, and great service!  It helps that our server had an awesome personality too and sold us on the pumpkin cheesecake.

I love CPK! I don't come here too often but whenever I'm in the mood for some lighter yet filling food.  I love their humus and Greek pizza. I've also had the jambalya, avocado egg rolls, and spinach and artichoke dip which are all good.  The servers are always nice and helpful!  Not to mention they have italian soda (:

They're my favorite chained restaurants now all because of the "Don't Open It Thank You Card" promotions~every time till end of July, you get to receive one of these cards, but if you don't, just ask the host or your waiter/ress about that game, and they'll give it to you.  It's really neat; that card tests your luck of the day!  LOL.  That's what I think when I go, but I really like their food.  You can't go wrong with this promotion because every card would start off at least a %10 off!!!  That's better than nothing?  I went with my coworkers to this CPK inside Brea Mall this past Tues on May/10th/2011 to hang out and cheer over dinner.  They appreciated the fact that I got them the 20% discount!   Our waitor was very courteous and explained to my coworkers how this promotion works cuz neither of them knew about it.  I think it's a great marketing strategy as it gets the customers motivated to go in and order.  But, if you don't like their food, don't go just for the game as it's pointless.   I love their Chicken Tequila Fetuccini as that's what my coworker and I shared on top of the three-piece Mediterranean Spring Rolls.  (These rolls are da bomb!!!!)  I'll probably be going back to CPK quite a bit to see where their promotions take me----they are offering cash prizes too, so you never know!!!

Came here with a friend after registering for a wedding...not my wedding, friend's wedding. We both were just looking to have a nice relaxing lunch after a day of scanning. I am not sure why Macy's makes registering for a wedding much more difficult than what it has to be, but that is a story for another day. So we order the Hummus with pita bread (meh...it was alright, the Hummus from Trader Joe's is better) Then we ordered the the dumplings (steamed) and the Chinese Chicken Salad. The dumplings were probably the best item. Simple, yet pretty satisfying and that is all I was really looking for. The salad was alright.  FYI ~  I tend to stay away from CPK i just because most of their items are very high calorie. If I am going to eat something with that many calories, it's not going to be a salad!

I think I like BJ's pizza over CPK. Variety of pizza is pretty good. Kind of expensive for a personal pizza 10-14$. Pastas are normal italian prices....they taste kind of empty like the way the pasta does when i eat olive garden.  I think it is just ok. just ok.

Thai Pizza. AMAZING. And the salad with the apples and walnuts. Dessert is always great here too. Been there with family and friends. A semi-costly casual dining experience I would summarize. Enjoyable? Yes.

I was here for lunch earlier today, hence my check in. I have to say, I tailored my orders to the reviews below, and I have to say, I was pleasantly delighted with my dishes! I came with family after a few hours of shopping at brea, and we ordered the vegetable delight pizza and fettucine. Personally, I was too busy diving into the fettucine to really get a grasp of the pizza, but my mom said it was great and I can definitely vouch for the pasta! Also, love the free bread with olive oil dressing.

You know this place. It's like your friend's mildly annoying friend, Lily. You wave hi, you tolerate her, but really, you just want to get on with it and be done with the experience. Came here with mah lady friend for food, we were both incredibly hungry after a 12mi jaunt through Fullerton... This was more of a functional meal than anything and we had their "moroccan salad." Speaking of which, if you call something "Moroccan" you better make it with REAL Moroccans, dammit! Anyway the place is aight for a chain. If you want more interesting fare, get out of Brea, ya bum!
I love the food but their service is so slow. You'll be waiting a good 10 min just to get water & another 20 for your food. Whether it's a busy day or not everyone moves slow in this place.

Came here with my mom for lunch.  Went in and were seated right away, and just a few minutes later the rush came.  Oman did it get crowded!  So I'd get there a bit early if you don't want to wait! We shared a pizza and salad, which was more than enough for the two of us.  The pizza was a vegetarian japanese eggplant  pizza on honey wheat crust.  I don't really like pizza, but this one was quite tastey :].  The salad we ordered was a shrimp salad with miso dressing.  This was pretty good too.  Next time we want to try the roasted vegetable salad.  That one looked amazing.   Other than that, it was an average meal.  Nothing stood out, but I'd come here again.
Came in tonite for our usual once a month weekend meal......got briana....excellent service...very friendly.......feels good to go out these days and still get your money's worth....

Came in today around 2:00 pm while shopping. We got seated right away. Service was super fast, and waiters were on top of their game. I ordered a Waldorf salad, and I got a grilled chicken for my baby daughter from the kid's menu. My salad was spectacular. My daughter on the other side, wasn't feeling the chicken (she's 16 months old), so I asked my waiter if I could change the chicken for pasta Alfredo. Waiter was super understandable and made the switch right away. Great staff, fast service, and an overall pleasant experience.

It's a major chain so you really can't expect much. Not as healthy as some items seem, everything is loaded with sodium. Portions are small for the price they charge and the quality also does not justify the price. Service was OK, food came out quickly and they do have plenty of options, but it was just very mass produced and you can taste that. Not worth returning.

Our waiter Jacob was great and deserves 5 stars! Food was fantastic! Drinks never empty! Why am I giving 4 stars?  When we arrived, we stood at hostess desk, there was a girl standing there in uniform, name tag with Alyssa, chomping on gum, drinking a cpk drink.......we waited! She stood there! Then she turned to us and said "I'm not on the clock!", what???  Really?? Just loitering around your job!  Anyway, I would definitely return for food and service!

Portion sizes and taste DOES NOT justify the $$.  I had the Bolognese Spaghetti for about $14. Barely any sauce and barely any flavor to the "hours long simmered" sauce.  The olive oil dip for the free bread has more flavor than the spaghetti.  Service was decent. Waiter said on our 2nd order of bread: "the bread keeps getting taken away. I'm not sure if I can bring you another. Is there anything else you want?"  Sure, the check.....

Came here tonight for dinner while shopping and since there was a wait we sat at the bar. Mo was fantastic, greeted us right away, and when I asked about sangria she was very knowledgeable about all of the kinds they offered. I tried the honey strawberry one and it was delicious! You also get a very large glass for the price which is a plus! The only missing a star is for how long it took for the food to come out, especially since being at the bar but they were busy so I guess it could make sense. Food was great though once we got it and so was the service (:

I went there last night. The pizza was super yummy and they were great about making sure no onions or garlic reached my dad's order as he is allergic. (I know... I worry about my own allergy to this as I get older. Right, now I just live with the slight discomfort....) Annie Joe helped us a great deal with our Pick Up. It seems the Grub Hub didn't "go through" properly, so when I went to get it, they had to make it from scratch upon my arrival. A slight annoyance, for how kind they all were and pleasant to deal with. And Annie Joe was so cute when a little girl came up to order with her mom. She gave her an adorable compliment and you could tell this little girl really appreciated it! So sweet. The customer service alone, make this a 10 star place. BUT PRO TIP: maybe call in your order, since the Grub Hub seem to regularly fail... Might be time to not be on Grub Hub CPK of Brea....

I WOULD GIVE 0 stars if I could. SAT THERE FOR 20 MINUTES AND WAS NOT SERVED. Servers were walking around and saw that my boyfriend and I were looking for someone to take our order.  It was not that busy, they attended to the 2 other tables next to us but completely ignored us.  I used to like coming to this CPK but I will not return to this location again.

Five stars simply because of our server, Allie!! She was the sweetest girl and brought everything we asked for with the biggest smile on her face! I'd go back just because of her! She deserves a raise
they changed their interior! but the bread is so bomb. soft and unlimited! other than that i love their pesto penne pasta!
great place to have pizza, salad ( must try the Morrocan salad), pasta and soup. They also have a great key lime pie.

The food was super delicious! Steven was our server and he was absolutely wonderful. He had a lot of tables to handle, as the restaurant was pretty busy on a Saturday night, but our service was still quick and perfect. He made great conversation during our meal and really made my dad and I feel welcomed. Thank you so much Steven, keep up the great work!

My daughter goes to Cal state Fullerton near by so we are often around the area and I have to say I love the Fullerton and brea area. Very safe very live and very active. Now back on topic, CPK is awesome I love to come here and order the California club. It's the best thing on the menu! The lady that helped us who name I can't remember was very annoying though. She talked to us like we were babies and came around a little to often but it can always be worst so who cares.
They are very unfriendly, unwelcoming. A simple Hello with a smile goes a long way !  It's the management's job to teach them what Great Customer Service should look like !

Bartender Jeff, horrible!! Drinks he made were horrible and he had a personality of a rock. Customer service lacked. We were still hungry and wanted pizza but due to his lack of customer service we chose not to order more food here. No enthusiasm!!

I placed an order with CPK a couple of days ago that arrived not only incorrect, but in complete disarray.  My pizza was burnt to a crisp and my salad sat for a half hour on top of an order of hot pasta rendering it warm and slimy.  As most of my food was inedible I called CPK and asked to speak to a manager.  I spoke to Fernando and explained that I had waited over an hour for my food, spent nearly 10 minutes on hold waiting to speak to him, and since I have a broken left leg and a broken right foot, it's not like I could run up to the nearest drive thru to get food.  This is when I received bar none THE highest level of customer service I have ever experienced.  Instead of giving me the number for Grub Hub to request a refund for my $50+ botched order, he said he would take care of that for me and asked if I would like the food re-made.  As it was 9:30 pm at this point and I was extremely hungry but immobile, I said that I would appreciate that very much.  He said that he was getting off work shortly, and instead of waiting for a Grub Hub driver to replace my order, he said he would deliver it to my apartment on his way home to ensure it was hot and fresh.  Not 25 minutes after I hung up the phone, there was Fernando at my door with my entire order of food remade, a copy of the email from Grub Hub confirming my refund, as well as $30 worth of vouchers to use on my next visit to CPK.  I was blown away and beyond grateful that the manager of a restaurant would take the time and effort he did to "make it right."

I am not sure why I keep going back to this place.  My kids love their fond memories of it, but each time we have gone recently, the service has been terrible, and the food is just MEH.  For what you pay for one pizza, you could have two made-fresh Pieology pizzas!  There are never enough servers, and they seem to not like to take requests from tables in other sections.  And, why do they bring out just 6 pieces of bread for a party of 4?  You have to wait forever for another plate of 5 or 6 more pieces.  Each time, they don't even give you enough for two per person.  We could have eaten at The Cheesecake Factory for these prices if we wanted chain restaurant food that actually tastes good.

They redid their interior and it looks a lot more spacious. I love CPK and is probably one of my to-go restaurants if I want some decent food. Food -bbq chicken pizza was amazing. was not disappointed and of course their pizza are delicious -lobster flat bread had too much mayo IMO. I had to use cholula sauce to wash down the mayo. I dont think it blends well with the flat bread. The lobster is soft warm while the flatbread is hard and crunchy. I think this would be better if served as like a lobster maine roll. -baked potato soup - way too cheesy. soup was cold and was not too great -quesadilla was like a caribbean style quesadilla. was in their appetizer section but wasn't all too good. not much cheese or chicken in it. Definite upside to this place was they free bread they give out. They improved it so much compared to their old bread and butter and this new one was so delicious! The waiter was nice but seemed very sad for some reason. Did not enhance my eating experience and wish he seemed happier. Overall for price, quality, and service this place is a 3 star. Five for pizza and their free bread, other was just mediocre

Service was horrible first of all the hostess didn't even greet us or bother to look up at us  Our server Shawn was the worst server ever took ten minutes for him to even ask us for drinks then when we ordered the avocado egg rolls they were out so unprofessional  Shawn never refilled our drinks and we could see him clearly talking to his coworkers in the kitchen we had to ask for the bill ourselves and hand it to a different server  this is really upsetting I would not recommend this place to anyone they don't deserve our money  Shawn even had joked and said I'm not checking back on you guys

The food is not worth the price. They offer very average flavors. The pizza is probably the best option on the menu. We go here as often as we do simply because we have gift cards. I don't think we'd come back otherwise.

OK so the food was not that amazing BUT... Service was outstanding. I say that AFTER my wife could not get her first request. Basically went there on a busy Sunday afternoon and sat on the patio. Only one other couple was on the patio and the inside was hopping. I usually do not like sitting outside because I always worry about getting served. Seems many places forget you. We sat down and with in moments the young man Chris came over and asked for our drink orders. He was back in 2 shakes with our drinks.  Few minutes later we placed our order. My wife ordered the Salmon and I ordered the Jambalaya. We also ordered the Devil Shrimp. The shrimp was deep fried and covered in some kind of delicious cream sauce. We both loved it. My Jambalaya was typical stuff not fantastic but definitely very good. The Salmon however was NOT available!! Oh My. How did they handle you ask?? Well prior to coming out our server checked with his boss and was told to basically give my wife whatever dish she wanted at no charge!!! What the ..... She ordered the Kung Pao Pasta which was nothing special but definitely tasty. We also had the Apple Desert with Ice Cream. The Crisp. It was good. Not enough Caramel.  Great Service guys. I cannot count the times this has been handled terribly. Many places I have been end up telling you about the missing dish once they bring everyone else's food. Handled in spectacular fashion. Great Job California Pizza Kitchen Brea

Their pizza is good - the food is consistent... its a chain folks.  What I didn't know you could do - my niece taught me this... you can order a pizza do like 1/3  different styles - like 1/3 - BBQ, 1/3 - Pepperoni, 1/3 - Thai.  I like that they will do that for you!
my favorite CPK.  bbq chicken salad, bbq chicken pizza, tequila fettucine = best good service.
The WHITE PIZZA is my new love. we only met today - love at first taste. cheese spinach garlic and bacon bits are ON IT.

When we were here last week, the service was awesome, I really wish I could remember his name. This location is hit or miss with service, and he really hit it out of the park. Had the grilled peach salad (do yourself a favor and just add bacon, it's not complete without it!) and the habanero carnitas pizza, both of which were really delicious.

We all know CPK is good.  They recently got rid of one of my favorite items, the Thai Linguini, but that isn't this restaurant's fault. So what set this one apart? Service was a little slow, but we went at 3:30, when staff is changing and things are calm, so that's forgiven. We always order the flavored lemonades because they are delicious. The one's here were super potent, with lots of flavor shots. Some may like this, but it was far too sweet and I could only drink one before switching to water. What I loved though was that our waiter boxed our left overs for us. This is one of the things I loved most about this restaurant and most CPKs have been failing to offer this anymore.  That's why I give this review an extra star, for class.
Pastas and salads are great here. Try the fried maccaroni balls there a good start. I always receive friendly service at this location.

I have no shame in pointing out that I've sampled most of the fare off the CPK menu and it is (generally speaking) all very tasty eats.  In terms of quality and taste, CPK pretty much delivers a consistently satisfying pizza every time I've gone.  If you're in the mood for an appetizer, order the wheat pita bread with oil and vinegar.  So good! I'm not sure it's actually on the menu.  I'm not giving the place 5 stars simply for the fact that I believe the prices should be cheaper.  This is more of a comment to ALL of the CPK's that I've been to in the past (and there have been many):  The servers have always been perfectly pleasant and prompt with the refills.  To my oft pretentious foodie friends, I assure you that CPK is chain restaurant where you can feel comfortable spending your dough. Pun intended =) Get some!

4 stars: The staff at the Brea Mall location are always very nice and it is always clean here. The tequila lime chicken pasta is my favorite. The white corn guacamole is both sweet and spicy. My husband liked the korean BBQ tacos and my children love the pizzas.  It's all good here!

All of my experiences dining here have been great, but I recently interviewed for them and I did not like how it was handled at all!  The manager was 30 minutes late due to a conference call, which I thought was a little unprofessional. By the time she finally got to my interview, there was already another girl sitting next to me waiting for her appointment, which was after mine.  After that, the interview went well & she told me I would hear back from them no matter what their response was by the weekend. I never got a call, so I called them twice. The first time I called, I was told that the manager was, once again, on a conference call and the second time, they said someone would call me back, but never did. It's been 3 weeks with no response & obviously I gave up on getting one a while ago. I think there is a huge lack of professionalism on that aspect. Aside from my interview experience, the wait staff is great! When I came in to fill out my application, they gave me a soda on the house which was sweet, and did the same thing while I waited for my interview. Eating here has always been good. All-in-all, my dining experiences have been great, but my interview experience was far from that.

The only complaint i have to make about this place is that they don't give out bread before the meal. They only give it to you when you ask. Drinks are okay, and pasta and pizza cannot be beat compare to other italian chain restaurant. Not as many choice of menu as cheese cake factory but i promise they know how to make pasta!
My boss gave me a gift card for this place and food tastes so much better when it's free lol. I had the garlic cream fetuccini and it was amazing and for desert we had the butter cake yummy

I love their Thai salad! I remember the Thai salad being different from way back in the days when I used to order it. Regardless, it was still yummy!!! We were there for hours and the server continued to refill our drinks. I loved the environment even though it was kind of loud in there.
This place is allergic to giving meat in your dish. Even when the item shows 56 grams of protein in the nutrition information....what a joke!
Great food and good service!!! Chicken tequila pasta is the best.....

dec 18. During december shopping this was just what I needed for a break. My wife and I were tired from shopping, getting mad at macy's crazyness. Here to the rescue strawberry margaritas and pizza. They must have because the second round was great! very rarely have I had a not up to the standard cpk but theyre all good. Excellent drinks and pizza

YUMMY in my tummy! I really like this place.. like, A LOT. But the funny thing is, I have yet to try their pizzas here. I usually always get their Kung Pao Spaghetti but before that, I would always order a small Caesar Salad first. Also, I really like their bread & butter. I know, it's nothing but geez they're really good. Service is decent and the atmosphere is pleasant.

Yuuuuuum, I absolutely love California Pizza Kitchen! Love love love it. Who can go wrong with pizza, especially amazing creative ones that tickle your taste buds with a warm, fresh bowl of artichoke spinach dip on the side. :) Mmmmmm. So it was a typical Tuesday night for my bf and I. After hitting up a few stores, we decided on CPK for dinner; an old favorite. Surprisingly, the restaurant was decently filled even on a Tuesday night yet the hostess managed to sit us quite quickly. We decided to try something different other than the thai chicken and BBQ chicken pizzas. We agreed on the Carne Asada with steak instead of chicken. Our spinach artichoke dip appetizer came out fast but our pizza took FOREVER. We practically nibbled on our appetizer and by the time we finished, our pizza still wasn't out! Thumbs down! What felt like a zillion years later, our pizza finally arrived nicely presented like all their dishes. Their Carne Asada pizza had an appealing pile of corn, onions, black beans, and tomatoes and an evenly amount of steak distributed amongst each slice. Mmm, it was really good! Imagine a burrito pizza, I know it sounds a bit funky but is really good, and spicy! If you can't stand the heat, don't even bother. If you can, ask for Chula hot sauce! CPK never seems to fail with their food however this one sure fails with their service which earns them my A-OK.

Just went again today and the prices were bumped up and the portions got smaller. I'm starting to think that my Chicken Tequila Fettuccine is not work $13 bucks! The service is still exceptional, but the prices are really bringing this place down. Sorry to say that I won't be here as often as I wish I could be.
If you are a Simon Kidigits club, kids get to eat free if you show your card.  Also sign up for their emails, it's worth it.  Oh, and of course the GCs are at Costco!

I get great service everytime I go to this CPK.  I also like how CPK has their hometown they started working at and how they are allowed to transfer to other CPKs if needed.  They also have not only great PIzzas like the Carneasada and Hawaiian, but they have awesome salads as well.
Mushroom Pizza with five or six kinds of mushrooms is my idea of heaven...OK, This place is in the MALL and the wait is sometimes a half hour, but the Mushroom Pizza is so very, very good...

This place is pretty good. I came here for numbers of family dinners and random outings. We always get the spinach and artichoke dip for an appetizer, its a must get when coming to cpk :) For a salad, I have only tried the Mediterranean salad, it was fresh and and pretty interesting salad that laid on a pita bread with hummus and I liked the taste of the avocado and sun-dried tomato's. For pizza's, the chipotle chicken pizza, its spicy and sweet at the same time with a mexican flare to it. My beau always gets the chicken marsala with chalula sauce (sadly it isnt on the menu anymore). All the pastas are pretty good. I've never been disappointed with what I ordered here. The amount of food here is always more that enough and I always go home with leftovers that I always end up eating later and my bf ends up stuffed like a turkey. haha :) oh and I always get the italian soda because its free refills and you can try all the flavors :P

Okay so I love CPK under normal circumstances, but I was a little miffed with my last trip there. We went last Friday and I really didn't like our waitress. She seemed like she was just doing a job not really enthusiastic about serving customers. They get one star for activating our sensor within 5 minutes(even though they said the wait would be 15) but it went so so from there. First we ordered drinks. I ordered an Iced tea but realized that I'd actually rather drink something fizzy with my food. When it was time for refills I asked for a diet pepsi intstead,(I've been at other restaurants where the waitress would happily oblige a change in drinks but not this witch(lol)). She said that if I wanted to switch drinks, they have to charge for a separate drink. I just accepted the policy but of course mumbled some stuff as she left. The reason this policy is so idiotic is because the Iced tea costs the same as the fountain drinks(at least at CPK) which in itself is a little strange because usually iced tea is a little cheaper. Idk gotta ask my waitress friend about this one! So a switch shouldn't have been such a big deal, but whatever! I still love that place enough to go back. Other than the drink snafu,the pizza and bread with butter was delish.................

can never go wrong here .. always a good experience .. casual dining with quick service. My favorite is the Thai BBQ Chicken Pizza and the Thai Crunchy Salad ...  entree salad itself is good portion so its good for 2 people to share 1 pizza and a entree salad.  I like the pizza here because the crust is thin .. not too heavy and all dough.
